hasVariant.name: Hardwear AP Active Pant - Men's
hasVariant.description: Buy the Mountain Hardwear Hardwear AP Active Pant - Men's online or shop all Clothing from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Hardwear AP Active Pant - Men's
hasVariant.description: Buy the Mountain Hardwear Hardwear AP Active Pant - Men's online or shop all Clothing from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Wow. I've been upgrading my wardrobe from khaki s and jeans to outdoor pants. I love them, comfort they provide over jeans. Light weight and durable as well.  I wear these at work and outdoors so the flexibility of use is endless.
review.name: Change is good!

review.reviewBody: Didn't realize the pant was "active"... so, there's more stretch, but they're thin and not as warm as the AP pant I already have... also, the fit is different... the AP pant has a shorter rise, so they don't "sag" in the crotch as much and also the pocket detail is different, the pocket opens flat to the belt line vs at an angle which makes it harder to get your hand into... overall, way more happy with the original AP pant than the active version
review.name: very different AP pant

review.reviewBody: Front pockets are terrible, way too short. Regular length fits like a 30" inseam so they show mad ankle. Knife pocket and seams ruins the front silhouette. A shame since the fabric is great, good flex and durability
review.name: Needs revisions

review.reviewBody: Liked the pants.  32 too short, 34 too long, overall kinda baggy fit
review.name: Not for me it seems

review.reviewBody: An amazing improvement over the AP pant. These are softer and even more comfortable.
review.name: My new favorite pants

review.reviewBody: As a fan of the original AP pant, I wanted to share that the AP active pant definitely runs smaller. The AP active is smaller in the waist, the legs are shorter and slimmer. Also, these don't have the button-up cuff. The material feels, and is, more synthetic (no cotton in the fabric blend).
review.name: Smaller than the Original AP Pant.

review.reviewBody:
These may be my new favorite pants. Purchased about a week ago and have been wearing them every day since I got them. I love the stretch and comfort of these pants. It's athleisure, but I can actually wear them to work. I have not taken them out on the trail yet, but intend to soon (once it cools off a bit).

As far as fit, the waist runs true to size. I typically wear a 38 waist and the 38 waist fit's perfectly. In fact, it fits snug, but not tight nor loose. The length, however, was an issue. Typically I can get away with a 32" length (I like my cuffs to rest on the top of my foot because I am barefoot more often than not), but I needed the 34 length just to get to the top of my foot. So I would recommend sizing up one size for length.

All things said, I have nothing bad to say about these pants. I'll probably buy at least one more pair in the future.
review.name: My New Favorite Pants

review.reviewBody: Great fit, flex and give. Warm enough, cool enough and well made as usual. 3rd pair I've purchased, I like.
review.name: I like

review.reviewBody: Pockets are too shallow and pants are a bit tight material is good though
review.name: They could be better

review.reviewBody: Bought these for my partner to wear to work where he is indoors/outdoors back and forth in the rain but needs to look professional. They look nice like regular work pants but are way more functional. The fabric is really sturdy but lightweight. The black is super sleek, buying a couple other colors for him. He is a 33x33 so usually in between sizes, 34x32 fits him well. The legs are little wide but that’s the only imperfection. Great pants.
review.name: Well made and good fit

name: Hardwear AP Active Pant - Men's

review.reviewBody: Again, I cannot review something you refused to sell me.  You sent me an add with prices and when I placed my order you canceled it.  When asked I was told the price was not correct but I could pay retail for the items.
review.name: Poor business practice
comment: Your feedback is valuable to us, and we are very sorry to have had to cancel the order.  we've emailed you to resolve the situation.

review.reviewBody: I got these gloves for swift water rescue course with hope that would proved some warmth and while maintaining finger dexterity for setting up 3:1 rope system. The issue I came across was that once my hands got wet the gloves were difficult to get on. The size I ordered was based on the manufacture's sizing guide. After struggling for several minutes to get the gloves over wet hands the fit was fine. I would not recommend these for anyone who is planing to use them for water rescue operations. Better off using using 2mm neoprene glove.
review.name: Difficult to get over wet hands

name: Hydroskin Glove - Men's

description: Buy the Nathan Pinnacle 12L Hydration Vest online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Pinnacle 12L Hydration Vest
hasVariant.description: Buy the Nathan Pinnacle 12L Hydration Vest online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Pinnacle 12L Hydration Vest
hasVariant.description: Buy the Nathan Pinnacle 12L Hydration Vest online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: I used this pack in October for a solo R2R2R and it was perfect!!! I Also, have the pinnacle 4L, Which I also love.
review.name: Highly recommend

review.reviewBody: I have owned my Pinnacle vest for 2 years and have definitely put it through the test with multiple ultras - several 50 milers, a 100k, and a 100 miler. It has proven its durability. So much storage areas and various sized pockets that I can find a place for any running essential. After long runs, I just toss it in the washer therefore it has even lasted through many washing machine cycles. I am not a fan of the insulated bladder it comes with so I replace it with a regular 2L Nathan bladder - I find these to be much easier to fill and MUCH easier to clean as you can turn them inside out. No amount of insulation can survive the AZ heat so it wasn't a feature that was important or beneficial to me. A great vest overall!
review.name: Durable!

review.reviewBody: The pack is light, plenty of storage, and fits nicely. Negatives are color options, only light blue and white, neither are what I wanted. I also do not like that I cannot reach the pockets, not located on straps, unless I take the pack off. Otherwise, the fit, the water not sloshing, the ease of cleaning bladder and tube, front pocket set ups are all amazing. I highly recommend this pack but wish their were other color options.
review.name: Best I've used but undesirable colors

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] What I love <3 about my Pinnacle Hydration vest ... The Flexibility ... Take it inside a tunnel! (those vinyl kiddo tunnels) The Versatility ... To run and jump! (And fall =P) The Durability ... To exercise and ... WRESTLE with! :) Weekly Video Contest fun with my family directing :)
review.name: Pinnacle Performance!

review.reviewBody: It may not be meant for daily use, I do run 10 miles a day... in Arizona desert. The zippers stopped working as they were getting harder and harder to use through my runs until they came completely off the track. I do have one of the front pockets left the other ripped. I have had it for a couple years now. I do still use it, will be replacing soon
review.name: Dont use the zippers

review.reviewBody: Overall, a great vest, well thought out and executed. My only partial gripe is that there is no ability to cinch in the back storage to make the entire vest snug and reduce jiggling when (a) the bladder is low/empty or (b) you're running without a bladder. Some sort of cinch system would be a very welcome addition to a great product.
review.name: Nearly perfect

review.reviewBody: I’ve tried so many different hydration packs and always come back to Nathan. I wish the bottles were more like the Salomon ones, but the Nathan packs are best. They don’t chafe and they are comfortable. We do also wish there was a better way to carry poles. I have both the women’s and unisex and prefer the unisex because it spreads the pack weight out more. I’m a Nathan fan and have 4 vests that I rotate. The blue unisex pinnacle is my favorite one. I’m a little worried able it a spot that’s already unraveling but fingers crossed it doesn’t come undone.
review.name: Nathan fan

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] The vest passed the first long run test during a winter weather advisory in Minnesota. It’s light, fits well, and has enough pockets (13!)  to carry all the fuel. I liked the Insulated 1.6L Hourglass bladder function too. Looking forward to the next episode with the vest!
review.name: An Asset to the Long Run

review.reviewBody: Love this pack. I use it for long runs as well as full day hikes.  The bladder is awesome because it is insulated and doesn't make a sound when I'm running. This was really key for me. Lots of great pockets in the front for snacks, my phone, dog bags and treats, and large pockets in the back for dog leash, shedding layers (I've fit a soft shell jacket, hat, gloves, and a fleece neck warmer all in there!) and bigger food items.
review.name: Highly Recommend

review.reviewBody: Vest seems well made but the bottom strap is only 6 inches long fully extended on the XL size. Not enough give for a comfortable run when the pack is full. The company doesn’t have extender straps so I returned it.
review.name: One big flaw…..

name: Pinnacle 12L Hydration Vest

description: Buy the Black Diamond Solution Harness - Women's online or shop all Climb from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Solution Harness - Women's
hasVariant.description: Buy the Black Diamond Solution Harness - Women's online or shop all Climb from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Solution Harness - Women's
hasVariant.description: Buy the Black Diamond Solution Harness - Women's online or shop all Climb from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: This is the 3rd Solution harness that my wife's had. This is by far her favorite harness of all time. Great support, no pinch points, yet light and flexible for hard sends. BD just keeps making this thing better and better. I highly recommend this to anyone who's looking for a quiver for both hard red-points and days in the alpine.
review.name: Best Workhorse on the Market

review.reviewBody: This harness is super comfortable and easy to adjust. I just replaced my old momentum harness and would recommend sizing up if you prefer looser leg loops because they do not adjust.
review.name: Solution Harness

review.reviewBody: This is my third BD harness, and somehow they keep getting even better. This harness feels comfortable but also incredibly secure. I love how the material is light but still makes for a comfortable hang. The gear loops are exactly where you want them to be. Overall, it’s just a fantastic harness that I can trust to keep me secure on any project I get on.
review.name: The perfect harness

review.reviewBody: Like this for ease of carrying in pack, lightweight, quality, plenty of features, and pack down small. Not quite minimalist but as close as possible while maintaining quality, comfort, and features.
review.name: lightweight quality

review.reviewBody: Miss only more gear loop!!! Even though, it’s the only one small enough (xxs) to fit on me with my trad rack
review.name: Xxs works for small people and trad rack

review.reviewBody: This was my very first harness purchase, and I couldn't be happier. It's comfortable to wear, and the color combination is fantastic. Highly recommend!
review.name: Durable, Comfortable, and Stylish

review.reviewBody: I didn't realize how comfortable a harness could be. It fits perfectly and is so well constructed too
review.name: Amazing!

review.reviewBody: I’ve used this harness on indoor climbs so far, and it’s super comfortable. I’m sure it’ll feel great outside as well. I’m curious how long it’ll take for the legs to stretch out - if they’ll stretch out at all, since it doesn’t have adjustable leg straps - but again it’s comfortable, lightweight and does just what I need it to.
review.name: Great harness!

review.reviewBody: This is my second solution harness. It route set, climb and belay in this harness so I am in it quite a bit and it is comfortable to wear all day at the crag and on long setting shifts. I also like the rigidity of the gear loops. Would definitely recommend
review.name: Durable and comfy

review.reviewBody: I bought this harness a few months ago and I really enjoy using it. I'm a man, but my legs are too large for the men's medium, and my waist is too small for the men's large, so this worked perfectly, since black diamond makes their women's harness' legs larger relative to the waist. It's super comfortable, fits great, very lightweight, and also easy to use. The only adjustment being the waist is quick and easy, and the buckle feels like a nicer material than their cheaper products like the Momentum (which use a still strong, but cheaper feeling plastic). The belay loop si really thickly woven and the hard points are reinforced with a hard material beneath the surface material, so I know I'll be able to use the harness for a while. The waist and leg loops are wide, making for a really comfortable sit while belaying and hanging. It's a very straightforward harness that feels really good. My only complaint is that the gearloops are lacking. They're small, and there are only four of them. This isn't a problem for the gym or 99% of single pitches, but anytime I want to bring extra gear for safety when I'm going outside, it can be tough to comfortably fit everything I need (2 belay devices, 8 carabiners, rescue loop, 2 alpine draws, a set of quickdraws, a cordelette, etc.). Otherwise, it's perfect and does exactly what I want it to.
review.name: Great sport climbing harness

name: Solution Harness - Women's

review.reviewBody: This boots was a let down for nearly $200 and nothing on the boot even feels quality. I have recently purchased a few other pairs of boots at the same price point and these were by far the worst. They also never even sent me the boot care kit I ordered. These shoes are not quality point blank. Thursdays boots are a much higher quality boot with more options at the same price point.
review.name: I would never waste me money on this product again.

review.reviewBody: Immediately had a hard peice in only the left boot that bent and would scrape my heel and cause horrible blisters. The right boot constantly squeaks no matter how clean or how much powder there is.
review.name: Blisters for months and a lifetime of squeak

review.reviewBody: Why are you stealing the leather orange insole from the Premium boot and replacing them with a cheap fabric one? The boots cost the same. The problem that Timberland has is that they are putting cheaper materials inside, and thats where they starting to fall apart. The rest of the boots are great but if a boot is premium DONT place cheap insole or cheap lining. I want my leather orange insole. You already did the same with my Premiums rubber toe Heritage! (If you dont post this review i will start writing all the time and putting all over the internet. Because i have bought to many boots and you are ruining the brand putting cheaper materials in linings and insoles)
review.name: If is Premium, you should put Premiun stuff in it

review.reviewBody: Hands down best boots I've ever owned. Extremely comfortable and I'm on my feet all day 9-5 and do about 8k steps daily. Never an issue and wear excellent. They won't let you down!!
review.name: BEST Boot Brand I've Ever Owned

review.reviewBody: Amazing!
review.name: Amazing

review.reviewBody: It was the best pair of boots that I have ever had.It is very good for style and working these boots are my new go to when I got outdoors. I would recommend these shoes to people who work in construction.
review.name: Yes I would it's amazing

review.reviewBody: This is a true story. I started wearing timberlands in the 1980's. I always wear the 6 inch timeberland hiker in wheat. Since my first pair, i have never worn another product other than timberlands. I am now 70 years old and still wear the same shoe all day and all night. You will never find a picture of me without them on. A pair of shoes usually last 2 years before I buy a new pair. My old pair then becomes my outside shoes and my new pair becomes my everday shoes. I have been doing this for the 50 years. I will be buried in the best and greatest shoes that I have ever worn.
review.name: Mens Timberland Premium 6 inch boot

review.reviewBody: I've been using them for 2 months, the inside is falling apart. They are cold for winter, they are useless! and they look delicate, I don't think they will last long, the outside gets scratched just by looking at it
review.name: Terrible Quality!!!

review.reviewBody: A great pair of boots that looks good with a pair of jeans. Very comfortable yet is weighty due to the quality of materials used.
review.name: Well made, hefty, though a bit too wide

review.reviewBody: I'm on round 2 of the nubuck wheat. Each pair I've bought comes from the timberland website. They tend to have a dark ring around the bottom where the nubuck meets the sole. I send them back they send me another pair with similar blemishes. I thought by purchasing them from the website I couldn't go wrong. Im stuck with a gift card, when I prefer to just have an unblemished pair of boots.
review.name: I would recommend buying them in a store

review.reviewBody: I'm an Adidas fan for more than 20 years, I only run with Adidas shoes, I tried hundreds of road and trail running shoes, but this model failed me big time. It doesn't have the needed support for trail running, it keeps pushing my feet to the inside although I don't have pronation issue, too wide, and the shoelaces are too long that I had to cut them. Also, I got the black color and it's so not suitable for trail running. Too expensive for the quality I got. I was really disappointed. Unfortunately I ordered it online from the US and my friend got it for me where I live and I couldn't return it. What a waste of money!
review.name: disappointing, not good support for trail running

review.reviewBody: These have become my go to shorts!  Perfect blend of everyday short that I can hike with or meet up with friends for lunch.  These and the 5” version are all I buy. Ow.
review.name: My go to shorts!

review.reviewBody: Love them
review.name: Great casual shorts

review.reviewBody: These run a tad small in the color I bought. I have read that sizes are a little inconsistent between colors, and maybe that is the case. The rise is shorter, feels more comfortable to wear a bit below the belly, however the waistband is a little tight for that. I might try to size up and see how it fits. XS is my usual size in Patagonia.
review.name: Runs a bit small

review.reviewBody: I bought the same style, different color, earlier this year and the shorts from back country are way bigger.
review.name: Sizing is completely different

review.reviewBody: Sizing is significantly larger than same item 2 years ago
review.name: Sizing significantly different than past

review.reviewBody: These shorts  are comfy, lightweight, and quick drying. I sometimes wear them over my swimsuit bottoms. They dry fast when they get wet. The mesh pockets are great  and drain well. A loop in one pocket is very convenient for attaching a key. The 2.5 inch inseam and leg side splits give mobility and the waistband is comfortable and stretchy. They are perfect for swimming, hiking, and relaxing. Great everyday short.
review.name: Light airy short. Love them!

review.reviewBody: The way the seams ride up on the behind make these shorts impossible for anyone with a butt to wear. Standing up straight, theyre fine. But once you start walking theyre awful. Sitting down they ride up into all your crevasses. 0/10
review.name: Weird Fit

review.reviewBody: I have a mint pair of these exact shorts, and they fit totally differently. My shorts I already own are size L, 2.5" and fit me like a glove. I ordered red L 2.5" shorts from backcountry and they are a solid 2" larger on the waistband and very stiff, not soft. I am disappointed in these shorts.
review.name: Small - Not Typical Patagonia Sizing

review.reviewBody: I'm actually kind of disappointed in these. There's zero stretch to this short, even in the waistband. Pulling them off and on is more of a struggle than it should be. I wear a 28 jean and bought a medium in this short and it's TIGHT. Beyond that, it's a great-if-not-a-little-stiff fabric and well-constructed. I expect that it'll last years and I'm hoping to break them in as I wash them. I just wish that it was slightly stretchy and more comfy. If stretchy and comfy is what you're looking for, this isn't it.
review.name: Meh

hasVariant.name: Chasm Laptop  26L Backpack
hasVariant.description: Buy the Thule Chasm Laptop  26L Backpack online or shop all Accessories from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Chasm Laptop  26L Backpack
hasVariant.description: Buy the Thule Chasm Laptop  26L Backpack online or shop all Accessories from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
I bought a few different packs to try, in search of a pack that can double as a vacation travel pack for airline/bus travel, easily fit under airline seat, but also get me to professional office meetings when I have to travel for work without looking too-outdoorsy/rugged, and this fits that bill perfectly. I love the simplicity and sleekness of the pack, and the fact it seems rugged/weather-resistant enough to handle at least some light rain during transport. 

There are only a couple of possible minor things that detract from a 100% winner for some people. One is if it's wet, inside the pack there is lack of any flap to fold OVER the top of the laptop sleeve inside the pack, so if the pack were still a little wet when you open, some water might drip down right into the vital ports/vents in the end of the laptop, or i suppose if pack was upside down the laptop could slide out (rare in my opinion). The only other thing I would improve is perhaps attach the straps a little different somehow so the pack doesn't hang out so far from the shoulders. I tested a couple of other packs and some (such as the latest Osprey Archeon 24L) felt much more snug/streamlined against the body. That said, I'm actually keeping this Chasm pack due to it being a little more clean/office-friendly looking for my needs.

There is one full-length major pocket which is the majority of the pack, but also another, slim full-size pocket that runs the full height of the pack, which I could see works well for some people and not others. If the main pocket were packed tight, it might be hard to get to items that may be at the bottom of the slim pocket, but there are already a variety of accessory pockets in that slim pocket, so to me the full-length is a benefit, to handle long items, or slip a jacket/sweatshirt down in without opening the main chasm. 

The pack doesn't have the flattest bottom, so may not say sitting up on end, and that may bother some people looking to use as an everyday office laptop bag, but to me that's minor, i probably will have it leaning against a desk or chair anyway, and helps improve the look without a rigid/flat bottom.

I also like the the zippers to the main compartments are in more of a U-shape, because on a plan I always slide my pack under the seat with shiny-outer side down, and straps up, that way I'm not transporting whatever junk is on the ground directly to the back of my shirt, and for that, the placement of these zippers is great, without all of your stuff falling out when you get into the pack. The small top-pouch zipper is just exposed mesh to the inside main cavity, but is very thick/fuzzy on the top/outer part of the pack to keep items (sunglasses /headphones) well protected from a random bump or smash.

I really like the side-handle and size-laptop zip to easily get laptop out for something like TSA/airport security if needed, or just quick/easy access without exposing everything that's in your bag. Due to that side-zip and sturdy side handle, there is only a water-bottle pocket on one side, but I don't see that as a problem since 99% of the time i have only one bottle. I also really appreciate this has a little strap horizontally in the back-padding for slipping this pack over the handles of a carry-on roll-aboard airline luggage, so this pack is a perfect personal item/pack for most airline travel (except some of those small planes or budget US/euro airlines). You wouldn't want a pack that was any bigger if you plan to put it under an airline seat.

Overall, pretty stoked on this pack, Thule does a good job and makes clean/pro looking packs. If it looks like it fits your needs, this is the one.
review.name: Great minimalist pack for office/travel

review.reviewBody: It wa a purchase for my wife she loves it! It is functional and practical
review.name: Love the new back pack!

name: Chasm Laptop  26L Backpack

description: Buy the Castelli Polare 3 Bib Tight - Men's online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Polare 3 Bib Tight - Men's
hasVariant.description: Buy the Castelli Polare 3 Bib Tight - Men's online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: I've only twice but i was really impressed with how warm they were.  I was out on a days that were a range of 33-45 degrees and the Polare's kept me warm.  I also think they are pretty great quality, like my other castelli tights.
review.name: Tights that keep you warm

review.reviewBody:
I own eight pair of Castelli bibs, including two pair of Sorpasso ROS bib tights. They are all size large and all form fitting, typical Castelli snug fit and sizing.

I tried the Polare 3 bib tights in a size large and they were way too big through the hips, so I tried the size medium. The mediums do fit, but there are thick, bulky fabric seams below the knees, and the shoulder straps are cheap and super tight. These are very uncomfortable bib shorts, and sized unlike any other Castelli bibs I’ve ever owned. The bulky leg seams are a real surprise, never seen anything like it in other Castelli kit.

Returned.
review.name: Weird Sizing, Bulky Seams

review.reviewBody:
I’ve ridden in some low temps (low 30s) with this and haven’t had a problem. It keeps the legs warm. Sizing can be a problem if you’re not used to Castelli or European sizing in general. I’d suggest going up two sizes.
5’10, 220 lbs, 29 inch inseam. I use XXL.
review.name: Great for cold weather

review.reviewBody:
The good news:  seems to be well made and is flexible and warm (have ridden wearing it at 38 degrees) and did not feel cold at all.

The bad news:  third time's the charm.  The third try finally go the size right, or as close to right at it is going to be.  Sizing is WAY TOO SMALL.  

So, I would recommend it so long as it is on sale and if a size two up from your usual size is available.
review.name: Yet Another Sizing Challenge

review.reviewBody:
Pros:
Very Warm
Wind proof 

Cons:
Very tight on the knee (deal breaker)
Lower quality shoulder area design 
Ok for short rides 

Score: 5 out of 10
review.name: Knee

review.reviewBody: The whole point of wearing cycling attire is to have minimal seams for maximum range of unencumbered motion. Having those non stretchy reflectors sewn right across back of calves is the most stupid design ever. Designer has to be a non rider, or have pencil legs. Every leg motion cuts across calf, guaranteeing calf cramps during ride, or at least severe irritability every pedal stroke. Very comfortable bib tights otherwise.
review.name: STUPID,STUPID design,instant calf cramps

review.reviewBody: I am 5'11 and 185# with a 32/33" waist. I bought the XL (my size in most Castelli which runs very small) and can't imagine fitting in something smaller. I've ridden these quite a bit this winter in Southern New England. Depending on conditions, I choose these, or the Tuto Nano which is lighter construction without the Gore-Tex Infinium layer on front. These are great and have given me access to many colder days (near freezing) when I'd otherwise be unable to ride.  An unsurprising consequence (on reflection) is that they do require more work to ride.  I find I can easily do 20-25 road miles in these, but at 30-35 I would be starting to flag. I notice it when riding in groups more so than alone.  I don't experience this with the Tuto Nano.  My unscientific read on that is that there is more bulk and fabric and that presents more resistance and more work.  I don't have a power meter on my winter/gravel bikes so no deeper analysis. I've also used for colder gravel and dirt/ice roads and they have held up through a number of falls (and cleaning) without issue.  The fit, wear and warmth have all met or exceeded my expectations.
review.name: Good Winter Bibtight

review.reviewBody:
I purchased this bib in 2020 and consistently use it in temperatures between 25 - 45 degrees. After two years, I've been very happy with it. Here's why.

- The seams haven't showed any signs of tearing, which is important in a winter bib that takes a good amount of tugging and yanking to get on.

-It's warm enough in the coldest conditions yet not unpleasantly hot if a cold morning ride ends in the high 40s or low 50s.

-The reflective aspects are key for rides in the early morning or after dusk.

Note: I typically wear a pair of shorts (full on padded bike shorts) beneath this bib. I like the added cushion and protection it provides against the wind. The other bonus is that it usually means I only need to wash the shorts unless the ride is really long. Gross. Gross but efficient.
review.name: Getting better with age

review.reviewBody:
I had a pair of the previous generation of this tight (Polare 2) and it never really felt good to me. These new Polare 3 tights get it right, though. The previous generation seemed incrementally too small for me, these fit great. The previous generation seemed to bind up in weird places and were a bit of a hassle to get on, these are comfortable and a treat to put on. The ankle zips have been moved to the side where they're much easier to operate, which eliminates one of the more annoying quirks of the previous generation.  The materials and workmanship on both are, of course, top notch. The only thing I don't understand is why they still equip this tight with their KISS AIR 2 pad instead of their top-of-the-line Progetto X2 AIR pad. Both are great pads, I'd just prefer the nicer option in these otherwise top-of-the-line tights. 

I can only really comment on their performance in cold, dry weather, but so far, they've been great in the upper 20F temps we've been having here in Chicago. I plan on getting another pair or two since they're considerably nicer than my other winter tights (PI AmFib) and probably 90% as capable.
review.name: Great winter Bib Tight.

name: Polare 3 Bib Tight - Men's

description: Buy the Mammut Lithium 15L Daypack online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Lithium 15L Daypack
hasVariant.description: Buy the Mammut Lithium 15L Daypack online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Very light weight. Fits comfortably. Removable waist strap depending on the adventure. Stylish
review.name: Good product

review.reviewBody: This bag is lightweight, sturdy and the perfect size. It works great for a climbing day, short hike, and even travel through airports. It looks flashy too. The small pouch on top works great for quick access items and the zippers don't catch. The phone pouch actually did come in handy for a day hike with a full sized iPhone.

I originally got this pack for day hikes, snowboarding, and multi-pitch climbs, but I found myself using this pack for my travels as well b/c it's a great size pack and it'll fit my 13" macbook.  The pack looks amazing and is well-constructed. One thing I also love is that it came with a rain cover.
I like it for day hikes to throw a jacket,  water, and some munchies for me and pupper. It might fit a laptop for air travel?. It rides well and is very light without causing a lot of sweat.
review.name: Nice day pack

review.reviewBody: Has a few options that make this back great. Small roll out pocket for cell phone, rain cover built in the bottom.
review.name: Nice little bag for day trip.

review.reviewBody:
The Lithium 15 backpack contains all of the features and functions of a larger hiking bag, but in a convenient size for day trips or air travel. I recently used this on a multi-leg cross-country trip where I needed a compact bag for airlines and for quick hiking around local trails. The small size was perfect for the plane, while the features such as chest and waist straps, hip belt packets, and integrated rain fly (!!!) came in handy.

I'd recommend this to anyone who is looking for a small bag to supplement their normal backpacking and/or travel gear. You won't be disappointed with the build quality or features packed into this 15L gem!
review.name: Perfect Travel Companion!

review.reviewBody:
Mammut is a company that I love, like, and hate. No other company exists in the space of my outdoor equipment consumer heart. I love Mammut's rain gear and hard shells. I have Mammut hiking shoes I treasure but boots that, no matter what, I can't find in the correct size. (I've sent back more of Mammut's footwear than I care to count.) I love Mammut's outdoor clothing, which might run a size smaller than I normally wear or two sizes larger. This is my first Mammut pack, which was originally sold for a ridiculous price and that I picked up for a ridiculously low price.

So the good part. If I were going out on a summer trail with just my water bladder, a rain coat, a few snacks, and a DSLR with a wide angle lens, this bag would be nice. The bag is well made. It's very comfortable. It's a roomy 15L. The upper pocket, where you might store sunglasses and/or food, is a great size. The compartment at the front of the bag has lots of space. The frame and it's support system are comfortable. The hip belt and shoulder straps are comfortable, even for this 230 pound hiker. The bag meets all the minimum requirements. If those are what you're looking for, this bag is for you!

However, if I'm going out in winter with that season's demanding list of items, this bag isn't going to meet my needs. And that's a disappointment.

I pushed the capabilities of the pack on my first time out. Here's what I found. 

The bladder storage is in the bag's main compartment and uses a pocket to hold the bladder close to the frame. A valve exit is on the upper right shoulder of the bag, so you're limited to the valve and hose being on the right. The loops for the valve are small. I didn't love this.

The bladder configuration has disaster written all over it. If a leak were to develop, there is no place for the water to go except into the bag's main compartment. There is no drain. The last thing I need is a bladder leaking all over my down coat if things go wrong, and, eventually, things always go wrong.

Attaching trekking poles to the pack is frustrating. The top elastic loop is on the left side of the pack, with a single, standard loop on the left side of the pack's base. I found it very difficult to get both tips of my three-section Leki poles through the single lower loop and the cork uppers through the elastic loop so that the poles felt securely affixed to the pack. And so, as expected, the poles kept coming out of their holds. This was a HUGE hassle. I gave up carrying the poles after about 300 yards.

I've never had a problem keeping poles affixed to other packs. Not being able to carry trekking poles feels like a significant design flaw. I've come to expect this feature on all of my packs. And did I mention things eventually going wrong? Loose trekking pole tips and bladders together never seem like a good idea.

I brought along my ice kleets on this audition. These did a great job of bringing to light another of the bag's shortcomings: there is no way to attach things to the bag without the item flopping around, at least not using something designed to meet this requirement. 

My ice kleets are carried in a heavy, cloth bag with a drawstring and loop on the bag. On previous packs, I've used the loop as an attachment point. Alas, the Mammut bag does not have a way to attach the kleet bag... Unless you use one of the compression straps looped through the kleet bag. This is definitely not what the compression strap was meant for and, so, the solution is rather kludgey.

If I had paid more for this pack, it would be going back. However, since I paid what I consider a low price for it, I'll use it in the summer when I often pick up rocks, take meat and cheese along for my hike, and seem to seek out rain. (I didn't get to try the pack's rain shell.) I really do love to be out in the rain. This pack will serve that purpose well, I hope.
review.name: A Disappointment and a Keeper

name: Lithium 15L Daypack

hasVariant.description: Buy the Giro Bravo Gel LF Glove - Men's online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: I've been using the Pearl Izumi full finger gloves for almost 20 years.  Loved them.  When it was time to refresh them, for some reason I decided to give these a try.  After a week, the stitching to the outside of your hand next to the velcro loop started pulling apart.  Mind you.  I bought 4 pairs and wear different ones each ride.  A year later, 3 of them have this same issue.  I never had this issue with the Pearl Izumi's.  I only replaced them because they were getting a little bit worn after years of use.  I'm going back to them for my next batch.
review.name: Stitching started failing after 1 week

review.reviewBody:
I have no issues with touchscreen compatibility like the others, but I also do not use a screen protector.  Tested on iphone with protector and it indeed does not work.
Otherwise an excellent glove, with padding in the places I like.  I use for both spring and summer road and gravel rides.  Correct sizing.
review.name: Touchscreen compatible with a catch

review.reviewBody: Nice, comfortable, good for in-between temperatures.  Fit is just like the other Giro gloves I've had.  Good padding, which isn't a sure thing in this type of glove.  So they're great, but....I can't use my phone with them on.  I was riding in an unfamiliar place, and any time I needed to check the map I had to take a glove off.  It's minor, but it is annoying.
review.name: Good but NOT touchscreen compatible

review.reviewBody: The gloves were nice but I returned them for one simple reason: they were completely incapable of activating the touch screens on my mobile devices even though the were advertised and labeled to do this. Otherwise they were nice gloves though I found them slightly undersized. If you don't care about the touch screen issue, I would buy them.
review.name: Giro Bravo LF Glove

review.reviewBody: Had these camp slippers for a few months and each time I used them my feet felt sticky and dusty. At first I figured it was dirt from the campsite but after looking into how to clean these shoes I learned that the tackiness was caused by the aerogel coming out. Other than this, these slippers are awesome and super comfy with some socks on.
review.name: Aerogel dust left shoes feeling sticky

review.reviewBody:
Very warm and comfy, with memory foam like insole.
I only wear these around the house and unfortunately a bit of aerogel dust leaked from one of the seams.
review.name: Warm and comfy, but aerogel leaked out.

review.reviewBody: These are extremely warm! They don't have support for the feet, but they are comfortable to wear around the house. There is not much traction or soul on the bottom, so they aren't good for walking around outside of your tent like I was hoping for. I have use them for bikepacking, and they were very packable and lightweight. Unfortunately because they weren't durable on the bottom for wearing around outside I wore through them quickly and also water with seep up through the bottom walking through damp grass in the morning. I upgraded to a pair with rubber soles (north face), so that I can wear them around camp and not just inside or inside a tent.
review.name: Alright for indoors

review.reviewBody: Cozy and easy to slip on for winter camping or around a cold house.
review.name: Warm and fun!

review.reviewBody: Absolutely love these booties! They are lightweight, easily packable, breathable, warm and super comfy. I've been enjoying wearing these around the house but look forward to wearing them around the campsite, as they will be the prefect camp slip-ons. I'm now considering buying the boots for more coverage in the winter!
review.name: Warm, Cozy & Lightweight!

review.reviewBody: I haven't had a chance to take these on a backpacking trip yet, but I love wearing them around the house and yard. Super lightweight, comfy and warm!
review.name: So warm and comfy!

review.reviewBody: These are like sleeping bags for the feet. Think campfire slip-ons, winter slippers, or even a quick walk in the elements to your Pilates class... true. Love these!
review.name: Best Booties!

review.reviewBody: Honestly everyone needs a pair of camp booties. These are super light, but comfy enough to also wear at home. 10/10 worth the cost!
review.name: Perfect for Home or Camp

review.reviewBody: Absolutely love these! They are warm and comfy. They're the next best thing to being barefoot. I like them so much, I ordered a similar pair (black) to have at work.
review.name: Awesome slippers!

review.reviewBody: I bought these to bring on a late fall/ early winter camping trip in the mountains. They did not disappoint -- warm and comfy! Perfect camp shoe!
review.name: Necessity for winter campers

name: Tundra Slip-On Aerogel Booties - Women's

Kept my soles cushioned, and feet warm and dry.

review.reviewBody: Before I wore this gear to hike in cold weather, my fingers always felt cold pain that made me feeling my finger would fall. Now, I did not have that feeling anymore whenever I wear this glove. Highly recommend it
review.name: Great Gear!

review.reviewBody:
These are great gloves if you have realistic expectations. They're comfortable and fit relatively well, though for my specific hands, the fingers of the gloves are just a tad too long, like 1/4". The leather is nice, and they're relatively warm. I wouldn't really use them for resort skiing, unless it was a particularly warm day, say 30F and sunny. I would say they're pretty great for touring down to 20, without much wind.

Disclaimer: I'm one of those that have persistently cold hands. If you're hands are never cold, you could wear these at colder temps.
review.name: Relatively nice for what they are

review.reviewBody: The price to value for these gloves are good. The thing that makes gloves last is maintaining them. The issue i am having with these gloves is that when I take them off to get something or scratch my nose, the inside liner goes out of whack with the exterior part for my pinky finger and is difficult to align back together. The fingers part is bulky and difficult to grab zippers for me so that is why i have to be taking the gloves off and on.
review.name: they are ok

review.reviewBody: Bought myself a pair of these gloves for a long weekend trip of climbing ice. These gloves were  fantastic! They allow a great range of motion and feel when holding an ice tool. Kept my hands very warm and allowed for quick on/off when I needed them! Would highly recommend!
review.name: Great For Techincal Ice Climbing

review.reviewBody:
I have two pair of these gloves. I grabbed them when they were on a really good sale a couple of months ago. At no more than 50% of the "retail" price, I'd say they are an OK buy. 

The quality of the leather isn't great. At only 5-6 days of snowboarding, I started to notice little spots where the top layer of the leather is wearing off from handling my board, strapping in, etc. They are still in tact, but you can see little grey spots showing through the black leather. Rubbed some Obenauf's LP on the spots, and chalked it up to just being a bit of a "value" material. Not THAT big of a deal, but we'll see how long they hold up. 

However, they do have somewhat of a fatal flaw. The lining isn't sufficiently attached to the outer shell. this causes two problems. The first is that the lining moving inside the glove causes a "slippery" feeling anytime you grab something, which really kills dexterity. The second (and most important), is that if your hands are at all damp or sweaty, the lining inside the fingers pulls out every time you take the gloves off, and is a real pain to get back in place. I've never experienced this with any other ski glove I've owned, so I'm not sure how it was overlooked. 

At a really good clearance price, these are still a decent value for resort riding, but anywhere near full price and I'd be very disappointed. If BC would have just put a hair more thought into the issues noted above, they would be a seriously great glove. Even at full price. The fit and features are on point.
review.name: Decent At Clearance Price.

review.reviewBody: Run small
review.name: Gloves, Size xl

review.reviewBody: Not the ones I wanted but at 1/3 the price I gave them a try. I have meaty hands and Large is not really Large for N American market. They will do but no extra give and perhaps they may stretch. Good enough for now. Quality OK and as I mentioned not crazy $$$ like USA made.
review.name: Run Small

review.reviewBody: They're comfortable to wear and fairly warm but these gloves are not at all durable. I had these gloves for 45 days and they already started splitting at the seam (see photo). Stay away if you require any durability from your gloves while skiing.
review.name: Not Durable

review.reviewBody: Can’t say enough about these gloves, they’re a no brainer at this price point. Bought these at the beginning of this season and have put about 10 days on them so far and they don’t disappoint. Keep my hands nice and toasty on on days where it’s -10 and days where it’s 32.
review.name: Love ‘em!

review.reviewBody: Gloves are warm and comfortable - used for resort skiing. The wrist tie strap is a lifesaver!
review.name: Work well

name: GORE-TEX Snow Glove

review.reviewBody: A really good boot! After 4yrs of no easy service in a wide variety of environments; mountains to swamp. The only thing I’ve replaced is the laces. They have maintained their waterproof and comfort very well. I would 100% recommend these to anyone. Look forward to updating to the IV even though these have plenty of life left.
review.name: 💯 worth it, 10/10 would recommend

review.itemreviewed: Targhee III Mid Leather Waterproof Hiking Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: I bought a pair of Keen Targhee III boots. After a few weeks of light use the boots developed cracks in the material. The boots continued to rapidly disintegrate. I have previously heard good things about the Keen. These boots were comfortable during the very short time they were usable but the quality is absolutely horrendous!
review.name: Disintegrating boots!

review.itemreviewed: Targhee III Mid Leather Waterproof Hiking Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: I have bought 2 pairs back to back years and they keep falling apart on me in less than a year. It’s unfortunate because I like them but I can’t keep buying a new pair of boots every year.
review.name: Shoe Falls Apart

review.itemreviewed: Targhee III Mid Leather Waterproof Hiking Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: Great product. Definitely the best trail shoes ever made. The giant sorrow is that I am a size 16 D men's and they dropping size 16 and 17 men's on all of the previous shoes that they carried in those sizes so unfortunately this will be my last and final purchase, So so so so so saddened by this. I have worn only Keen for 15+ years. The big problem is no other shoe made in a size 16 men's could compare to the Keen quality and comfortability. Tough times.
review.name: Absolutely LOVE the Keen Targhee 3 Mid

description: Buy the Petzl Actik Core Headlamp online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Actik Core Headlamp
hasVariant.description: Buy the Petzl Actik Core Headlamp online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: I had this shipped to my moms house. By the time I visited and opened it was past 30 days. I found they shipped the model with AAA batteries (not rechargeable). Had to order Actik Core battery from Amazon another $30
review.name: Recieved without rechargeable Battery

review.reviewBody: I know the product I wanted.  What I really like is the customer service.  One of the BEST.
review.name: Good price. Fantastic Customer Service

review.reviewBody: 600 lumens and three-stage brightness adjustment. It is very convenient for use while traveling and cooking at the camp. What’s even better is that it can be charged using USB, eliminating the trouble of buying new batteries every time you go up the mountain.
review.name: High CP value

review.reviewBody:
Check out the Petzl official video on how to use the Actik.  

Battery installation -  included CORE rechargeable battery but option to use (3) AAA 
How to cycle between three brightness levels - max 600 lumens
How to enable the red LED lighting option 
Manage burn time with battery indicator 
How to lock the headlamp for travel to prevent accidental turn-on
Options for headband or neckband use  
How to use the included storage pouch to turn the lamp into a lantern 
How to adjust the elastic headband
review.name: Dependable with lots of functions!

review.reviewBody:
The single power button is large and rubberized.  

The fulcrum mounted lamp may be tilted up or down.  

It comes with it's own Li-Ion battery pack which has it's own charge indicator light. Lithium is your best bet for a rechargable battery in cold conditions.  

Great set of options for brightness - easy to scroll through.  Has a solid red and blinking red setting.  To get to red, all you have to do is light up the white light on its lowest setting, hold the button down and it swtches to red - which makes sense if you need to turn to talk to someone in the dark.  Otherwise you can keep bumping through the brighness settings with a touch of the power button.
review.name: Mountaineering grade headlamp

review.reviewBody: Flipping from red to white, with the different brightness and strives is only fine serially. The rechargeable battery has an LED on it that shines thru the light lens 24x7. It’s very expensive and backcountry.com has a stingy return policy. Amazon or REI next time.  What happened to Petzl’s UI?  OMG it’s over thought and cleanly.
review.name: Non intuitive

review.reviewBody:
As a backpacker, ice climber, and general outdoor guy I’ve had a ton of headlamps in 30 years.  Huge fan of Petzl lights and never had one fail me.  The core battery is excellent and holds a solid charge.  Also easy to charge with a power bank while out on a 2-3 night trip.
I currently own an Actik (400l), the Swift SL, and now this one.  I was intrigued but the upgraded options compared to the 400L model.  Really everything I would like changed: light pivots better from middle (like the swift reactive), has a lock on the improved button, battery level gauge, easier to tighten strap, Orange model (to find easy), a bit brighter first click, and the glow in the dark circle which makes it easy to find at night (great idea).
I’ve used on my past 3 trips and really like.  I’ve been using my swift SL, which adjusts the beam and has cool features, but this seems like a solid go-to and maybe better in winter compared.  Only small issues is getting to the battery and door open.  It’s behind the pivot and it has to shift forward a bit to get to door, funky first , op and other times you do it.  They very sealed door was super hard to get open the first time. Was very tight and I almost needed a tool, and you use your fingernail for that!  Once open 1-2x, it’s easier for sure….just very tight.  If you like Petzl lights, or have had BD issues, this is worth a look.
review.name: Big fan of Petzl lights and core battery

name: Actik Core Headlamp

description: Buy the Black Diamond Traverse Pro Ski Poles online or shop all Ski from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Traverse Pro Ski Poles
hasVariant.description: Buy the Black Diamond Traverse Pro Ski Poles online or shop all Ski from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Traverse Pro Ski Poles
hasVariant.description: Buy the Black Diamond Traverse Pro Ski Poles online or shop all Ski from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Been mountaineering to BC Skiing to many other adventures with BD poles, always work great, are strong and can handle expedition abuse
review.name: Reliable Great Poles

review.reviewBody: These poles take abuse and keep asking for more! Wish I had bought another pair
review.name: Sturdy and lightweight backcountry essential!

review.reviewBody: I finally broke one of my Traverse ski poles after 12 years of abuse. Great pole. Of course, I thought the new Traverse Pro would be a better replacement than sticking with the original. I wasn't sure about the breakaway wrist straps, but the new FlickLock mechanism and lighter weight sold me. These two features are great, but the grips/straps leave a bit to be desired. First, the grip is shorter from top to bottom than on my original Traverse poles, with a much more pronounced bottom prominence. I'm a pretty average sized guy, 5'10'', 180, who wears a size large glove/mitten, and this grip immediately felt really small. After a few tours I couldn't stand it and had to use a bench belt sander to grind off the bottom rubber prominence. They are much better now as I don't feel like my hand is pushed over the top of the grip all the time, but if you've got XL hands, this might not be the pole for you. Also, since I don't ski with wrist straps in avy terrain, I pulled off the included straps, but the quick release mechanisms are still in place in the grip. Now there is a little rattle with every pole plant. Not major, but annoying. The weight savings from the classic Traverse Poles may not be 100% worth it for the extra cash, but the poles are super sturdy and ski well.
review.name: OK update on a Classic... except the Grips

review.reviewBody: They are not the lightest but they adjust and lock nicely. They are super sturdy and the straps function great and safely.
review.name: Great Poles

review.reviewBody: I love these poles. They are light, well balanced, easy to adjust and strong. There is nothing more that I need in a backcountry ski Pole. Highly recommended!!!
review.name: Great poles

review.reviewBody: I'm still waiting for some snow to give these a try, but I like the new latches a lot, and they seem just fine in all other ways. It's a little non-obvious about the lock and unlock for adjusting the wrist straps, but not difficult one you understand that you actually flip the tap all the way around to go from unlocked to locked. I also found that putting a little wax on the threads to put on the baskets, and using as much downward pressure (with the handle on the floor) as I could finally got the baskets on. I don't mind that it was a bit hard, there's no chance they'll come off accidentally, but if you don't have much arm strength you may need some help putting the baskets on.
review.name: I like the new latches

review.reviewBody: Love ‘em. Lost the first pair. So durable & adjustable.
review.name: Light, easy to adjust

review.reviewBody: The grips are comfortable, the locking mechanism works well, and they are almost as light as my pair of 6 year old carbon poles.
review.name: Great lightweight touring poles

review.reviewBody: Very versatile, love that i can change length very easy!
review.name: Very versatile, love that i

review.reviewBody: I couldn’t figure out from the directions how exactly I should put the baskets on. I guessed and thought I had done it correctly but lost both of the baskets on my first tour.
review.name: Lost baskets....

name: Traverse Pro Ski Poles

description: Buy the Vision Metron 45 SL Disc Wheelset online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Metron 45 SL Disc Wheelset
hasVariant.description: Buy the Vision Metron 45 SL Disc Wheelset online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Metron 45 SL Disc Wheelset
hasVariant.description: Buy the Vision Metron 45 SL Disc Wheelset online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: I've been riding for over 50 years and never had a set of carbon wheels. These wheels are more than I needed but I decided to treat myself. The change from the stock wheels was amazing. They feel and sound great. I'm not sure I am any faster but they do feel quicker off the line and faster on the flats. They were more expensive than I had planned to spend but I am happy I did.
review.name: Great Wheels

review.reviewBody: I have owned and ridden quite a few wheelsets from other brands. Wheels like Zipp 303, 404, 454, and Roval Rapide CLX. I was pleasantly surprised at the performance these wheels gave while still being easy to setup and service. Setting the tire bead on the rim was a breeze, and it wasn't a giant pain to pop the bead if I needed to add more sealant. The new Vision hubs are also a real treat because they use a ratchet ring that is similar to the ever reliable DT Swiss EXP hubs. They are also LOUD. If you want a great sounding loud hub, these are the ticket. The wheels come with tubeless tape and stems, and a great storage bag that I wasn't expecting. The ride quality of the wheels is great, and the aero is everything you would expect from a tour winning product. It's like a combo of my favorite things from Zipp and Roval. Overall would absolutely recommend these wheels.
review.name: Great Wheelset!

review.reviewBody:
I’ve been running these on my road bike for a few months and love ‘em. 

The important details:
1. 21mm internal width with a hooked bead
2. 45mm rim depth
3. PRS ratchet hub with a 5 degree engagement angle
4. I weighed mine at 1,521g with rim tape, valves, and lockrings.
5. No rider weight limit on these or any other FSA/Vision wheelset

These really are one wheel to do it all. I’m a fan of running as deep a wheel as you can get away with, and where I live (Front Range of Colorado), it’s important to consider weight and crosswinds. 40-50mm depth wheels are perfect for me and most of my riding. 

I’ve got some 28mm Vittoria Corsa Next (my favorite road tire) set up tubeless on these. These have a hooked bead, so you can run whatever tires you want, with or without tubes. I have had good experiences with hookless road wheels, but having the flexibility of a hooked bead IS nice. 

These are a pro level wheel, but they strike a reasonable balance between stiffness and comfort. That may come down to my preference of tubeless and corresponding lower pressures, but they also spin up pretty effortlessly and hold speed better than any other wheel I’ve ridden in this depth range. No perceptible lateral flex when sprinting; you get that nice “kck kck kck” as you sway the bike out of the saddle.

No issues with spoke creak or detensioning (I didn’t check spoke tension out of the box). I usually prefer j bend spokes for ease of service but these straight pull spokes have been solid (they do look cool too) and they tend to be a tiny bit lighter than j bend. 

The rear hub is objectively loud, especially at speed. Pretty typical deep thrum you hear from hubs with ratchet internals. 

These come with a rim strip installed, but tubeless tape and valves are included, along with some nice simple wheel bags for travel. They also come with internally-splined rotor lockrings and a cassette spacer.

If you’re looking for a top tier mid-depth wheelset with a hooked rim, you can’t go wrong with these. These would pair well with an endurance bike, they could be a gravel race option, or even as a shallower choice for an aero race bike. They’re lightweight, especially for this rim depth. 

Feel free to reach out to me or any other bike Gearhead here with questions or if you’re interested in choosing these for a custom build with us!

#CompetitiveCyclistGearheads #BackcountryGearheads
review.name: Excellent All-Rounder

name: Metron 45 SL Disc Wheelset

review.reviewBody: I have the previous iteration and wonder if this new version is better at wind penetration. Riding down a modest hill (4%) in 45 to 50 degree weather you can feel the cold on your hips and in your groin.  It does not block out the wind.  I have worn them with sun skins underneath and the legs feel comfortable in wind.  Would have to wear some kind of liner for the hips, etc. to get the same wind relief, but that is not really the way these are supposed to work.  They fit well and are stylish, but I am not sure why they cost more than the FR-C version.
review.name: No wind protection in the prior version

review.reviewBody: Bought these for my husband as a mail carrier and he loved them. Is able to disburse mail and keep hands warm.
review.name: Fantastic

review.reviewBody: They work ok for my needs will be getting more wen ther needed
I gave these as a gift and thought the quality was excellent. They fit true to size on the small size. Even the thumb flips!
review.name: Excellent Quality

review.reviewBody: I'm an installation/repair technician for a major telecommunications provider. These gloves give me the warmth and versatility I need at work.
review.name: Outstanding  !!!

review.reviewBody: The flip-it gloves aka as mittens are as pictured although the thumb has a slit for allowing for extra usage ...searched a few places and found them here. After placing the order then turn around around and hold your hand out ...that's how fast they arrived...I'm tell'n yah!
review.name: Hold your hand out ..eyeeee'm tell'n yah !

review.reviewBody: Bought these last year and they are still going strong. I appreciate the magnetic closure and the gloves overall performance. I will definitely be purchasing another pair once I inevitably lose them or wear them out.
review.name: Flippin’ great gloves

review.reviewBody: I absolutely love this gloves! I work at the PO so I need the dexterity of my fingers but the warmth so they don't freeze off. I was a little skeptical they would hold up since I'm always using my hands but so far so good, not even a fray.
review.name: Made for me!

review.reviewBody: These gloves are perfect for my job. I work outside all day reading residential/commercial meters. Even in -4 degree (with windchill) weather these gloves did great. Best bang for the buck.

They were a little smaller than I expected, but it expanded a bit once I started wearing them. Ultimately, they work well for what I wanted them to do, which of course is to let me eff around on my phone while outdoors, WITHOUT taking off my gloves/mitts.
review.name: iPhone's best friend

review.reviewBody: fit much better than earlier version, would recommend to anyone.
review.name: functionally satisfying

name: Fleece Flip Mitten - Men's

description: Buy the SOREL Ona 503 Hiker Shoe - Women's online or shop all Footwear from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Ona 503 Hiker Shoe - Women's
hasVariant.description: Buy the SOREL Ona 503 Hiker Shoe - Women's online or shop all Footwear from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Ona 503 Hiker Shoe - Women's
hasVariant.description: Buy the SOREL Ona 503 Hiker Shoe - Women's online or shop all Footwear from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: The shoes look exactly like the photo but what is more important is that they are very comfortable
review.name: Comfortable!

review.reviewBody: Not sure why people say they are too narrow -  I have a regular width foot and I think the tow box is almost too wide. But I’m not wearing extra thick socks - just good wool socks. They are super cute and ultra cushy. I agree that the arch support could be improved. I have not tested the waterproofing and I’m concerned they’re getting to look dirty because they’re a light color, but I’m willing to keep them to try since all of my other Sorels have proven to be waterproof.
review.name: Regular fit - super comfy

review.reviewBody: The cushioning is so comfy.  These are probably not for you if you have super wide feet, these babies are narrow! I was in a downpour of rain and they kept my feet nice and dry. The suede held up! They’re so cute. I haven’t taken them hiking but they’re great for bebopping around in wet weather. True to size. But I’d size up if you’re wanting to wear super thick chunky socks.
review.name: Functional AND cute. For narrow feet!

review.reviewBody: I bought these boots for a trip to Disneyland where it was supposed to rain and I needed some waterproof shoes. I know it was a gamble given I’d be walking a ton and the boots would be new and not broken in, let alone me not knowing if they’d be comfortable. I lucked out. We walked 3 days straight in them (my husband got a pair too) and our feet were warm, dry and comfortable. A near miracle. No blisters or rubbing, the shoes are light and grip well. I’m super happy with my purchase. Not to mention they’re super cute!
review.name: Get them

review.reviewBody: They are cute, sure. But the toe box is unbelievably narrow which defies the whole purpose of buying a hiking boot. I have narrow feet as well, so I can’t imagine who this shoe was made for.
review.name: Fails at its function
comment: Hello Nicole, thank you for taking the time to leave us feedback. We’re sorry that our Women's ONA™ 503 Hiker Boot is hard to size. We’re happy to help assist with the issue if you will reach out to our Customer Care team at (888) My-SOREL. Thank you.

review.reviewBody: Perfection. I absolutely love these boots and wear them all the time.
review.name: Perfection.

review.reviewBody: These boots are stylish, functional, and the sole is comfortable. But the toe was soooo narrow and was not comfortable enough for me to keep. I don't typically need "wide" shoes, but these were too narrow. Such a bummer because otherwise I loved these shoes!
review.name: Almost perfect... too narrow
comment:
Hello 
krs314, thank you for taking the time to leave us feedback. We’re sorry that our Women's ONA™ 503 Hiker Boot is hard to size. We’re happy to help assist with the issue if you will reach out to our Customer Care team at (888) My-SOREL. Thank you.

review.reviewBody: I have bought SOREL shoes in the past and have had my Explorers for two years now. They last. Good brand. These shoes look great, however they weren’t for me. I returned them. This doesn’t mean that there was anything wrong with them. Upon trying them on, they just weren’t my style. I will be looking for another style shoe and perhaps endeavor to visit a store to try on first before purchasing.
review.name: Great shoes just not my style

review.reviewBody: I haven't worn these out yet, but the fit is good and they are made very well.  Very good looking shoes and love the color.
review.name: Good looking shoes, great color.

review.reviewBody: Absolutely LOVE these booties. I bought them because of their sole and how it seemed they’d be good to walk (for exercise!) in the snow and ice… and THEYRE phenomenal. Paired with a thicker sock these keep the feet warm and grip! We’ve had snow and snowmelt and they’ve been great in both. Also are cute for bopping around town.
review.name: LOVE

name: Ona 503 Hiker Shoe - Women's

review.reviewBody:
Now I love the Cranks!!!
Thanks Back country for getting me straight..
All seriousness the 105 groupo is perfect for me value performance it's got it all. Very happy with the chainring sizes. I raced in my youth back then 175 mm arm length 52 big chain ring 38 small not that I used it... (That is an old racer joke)  I went with the 172.5mm 50 36 I am told I should go with a 165mm. Baby step I still think I can push the big chain ring.

description: Buy the Julbo Renegade REACTIV Sunglasses online or shop all Accessories from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Renegade REACTIV Sunglasses
hasVariant.description: Buy the Julbo Renegade REACTIV Sunglasses online or shop all Accessories from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: I am a big Julbo fan and have had many pair of Julbo sunglasses and goggles.  This pair fell short though.  It was my first experience with the Reactiv lenses.  The optical quality was awful.  There were optical inconsistencies and aberrations everywhere.  I never got to fully explore the photochromic lenses as the optical quality was too distracting to want to wear them very long.  I returned them immediately.
review.name: Great style; really poor optics

review.reviewBody: These have been my primary trail running/mountain sport sunglasses for the past year and I highly recommend them. They transition plenty dark enough for sunny days above tree-line, but change quickly enough so that I can keep them on while passing through forests. The lenses are big enough and bottom frame small enough so that seeing my feet in my peripheral is not an issue. They are also incredibly lightweight which means you can keep them on for all-day efforts without annoyance.
review.name: Lightweight and comfortable

name: Renegade REACTIV Sunglasses

review.reviewBody: I am 5'10" 195 pounds 38 waist. The XL fit perfectly. A very comfortable, compact, warm and high quality base layer so far.
review.name: A Great Base Layer in Every Way So Far

review.reviewBody: Of the handful I’ve tried (REI brand, UA, Peak to Plateau), Patagonia Capilene is unquestionably the best. Not only does it wick, breathe, and dry quickly, nothing even comes close to its feel against the skin—luxuriously comfortable. The material can snag on stuff relatively easy though if you’re wearing it by itself, but under a shell or jacket/pants it keeps me warm and dry better than anything else I’ve worn
review.name: THE BEST base layer

review.reviewBody:
When purchasing Capilene midweight in 2018, it was three-dimensional, and the material was more like quick drying clothes

The new Capilene midweight becomes soft and elastic, which is not as good as the old version. Personally, I don't like the new style
review.name: I don't like the current Capilene midwei

review.reviewBody: See my original review of June 2019. I wear them 10 months out of the year and wash them regularly. Without a doubt the best performing piece of clothing I have ever owned. Does everything its designed to do and does it very well! I am totally impressed with Patagonia performance and quality is second to none.
review.name: Simply & unequivocally the best!

name: Capilene Midweight Crew Top - Men's

review.reviewBody: Beware of Backcountry’s shipping policies.  My order was supposed to be received in 3-7 days with standard shipping.  When I called, after not receiving my order, I was told it was instead shipped economy, which takes 10-14 days.  The rep said, “this just happens sometimes”.  If you’re expecting your order within a certain timeline, buy from another site. This company should not be trusted.
review.name: Beware of shipping policies

review.reviewBody: My daughter loves her new jacket, I mean all three of her new jackets! Very warm and waterproof.
review.name: 3 in 1 = winner

review.reviewBody: Jacket is super warm. Love the versatility of it. Its not super heavy.
review.name: Would buy again.

name: Freedom Triclimate Jacket - Kids'

review.reviewBody: Materials felt great and surprisingly lightweight.  Zipper was mediocre.  Three of the baffles (front and back) had very little down in them.  Backcountry support was rather unhelpful and told me to contact Western Mountaineering directly.  Western Mountaineering support was very friendly and quick to respond, offered troubleshooting steps, and ultimately offered to refill the empty baffles if I paid to ship the bag back to them.  Felt that I shouldn't have to pay out of pocket to fix a manufacturer's defect on a brand new item, so ended up returning the bag to Backcountry.  It's a shame, I wanted to love it, but for such an expensive item I would expect better quality control.
review.name: Overhyped

review.reviewBody: I have the mega lite sleeping bag that I bought from backcountry in 2013 - 10 years ago and it is still looking great and proforms like new. I will be using this winter when I am primitive camping in Florida. I live in Florida so I also sleep in it in the summer season I just change my sleep pads, summer pad and my winter pad. I recommend the mega lite it’s definitely worth the price.
review.name: Mega lite

name: MegaLite Sleeping Bag: 30F Down

review.itemreviewed: Bare Steps A83 Sneaker - Toddler Boys'
review.reviewBody: Looked like a nice shoe.  Unsure of quality as we had to return.  Thwy fit pretty big
review.name: Bug fit

review.itemreviewed: Bare Steps A83 Sneaker - Toddler Boys'
review.reviewBody:
Pros: Flexible sole, available in wide sizes. 
Cons: Too hard to put on. My kid loved the bare steps boots and the water shoes, but these are impossible to put on his feet. 
We wore these (tried to wear these) this year and I bought another pair a size bigger to take advantage of the sale at the time. Now we won't wear the next size and wasted money.
review.name: Hard to put on.

review.itemreviewed: Bare Steps A83 Sneaker - Toddler Boys'
review.reviewBody: Unfortunately these got a big hole on the big toe after only 2 weeks of wear. They did not withstand the active life of a toddler.
review.name: Did not hold up
comment: We would love the opportunity to help at 800-288-3124 or live chat at Merrell.com.

review.itemreviewed: Bare Steps A83 Sneaker - Toddler Boys'
review.reviewBody: I got these for my 10 month old who is walking everywhere. They are great because she can feel different surfaces and elevation changes, but they also protect her little feet. Plus, they are adorable and very durable.
review.name: Awesome shoes!

review.itemreviewed: Bare Steps A83 Sneaker - Toddler Boys'
review.reviewBody: Amazing shoes that our daughter really loves! Buy them.
review.name: We really like these!
comment: Thank you for the great feedback!

review.itemreviewed: Bare Steps A83 Sneaker - Toddler Boys'
review.reviewBody:
This shoe has been the BEST for my 2 year old. They are sturdy, and made of quality materials, yet they are flexible and not stiff. The wide toe box has been amazing for my daughters feet. They are no longer squished ! 
I love the easy velcro strap. 

I use these shoes and an arch support insert for my toddler because she has pronation and needs it. 

She runs and jumps and plays in these better than any other shoe we have tried.
review.name: The perfect shoe for growing feet
comment: Thank you for sharing this awesome experience!

review.itemreviewed: Bare Steps A83 Sneaker - Toddler Boys'
review.reviewBody: Shoes fit as sized , just the right amount of flexibility for play. Have had numerous pairs as she out grows them. Best comfort and roomy shoes ever. Easy on and adjustable straps for just the right fit. 😊

review.itemreviewed: Bare Steps A83 Sneaker - Toddler Boys'
review.reviewBody: I bought these shoes for my son and daughter about 2 months ago. I love the look and flexibility of the sole.  However, my kids won’t wear them because the are too tight around the middle of their foot. My daughter even had a half size bigger than her normal shoes size.  If there was a way to adjust the strings to loosen them, then I think I would love this shoe.  It would also help to get them on the foot easier.  But as of now, I have bought my daughter two sizes and they are both too tight around the middle of her foot.
review.name: strings make them too tight

review.itemreviewed: Bare Steps A83 Sneaker - Toddler Boys'
review.reviewBody: So I want to start this off by saying I bought these because I LOVE the bare steps kids boots Merrel makes. They’re ergonomic (nice wide toe box and flexible sole), great quality, so cute and my daughter can easily take them on and off by herself. They’re amazing. In fact I plan to buy her another pair this year. The same cannot be said for these shoes. They’re still great quality and ergonomic, but they are SO DIFFICULT to put on. Don’t let the Velcro fool you. The elastic band (which is what REALLY holds the shoe on the foot) is super inflexible so I can’t open them wide enough to put her foot in. It’s not impossible, but it’s such a challenge that I rarely bother. At which point…I’m just paying good money for shoes that sit in the closet.
review.name: Hard Pass

review.itemreviewed: Bare Steps A83 Sneaker - Toddler Boys'
review.reviewBody: The shoe hurts my child's feet when putting it on and taking it off, despite having purchased the wide width. I thought the velcro strap would make it easy for her to wear the shoe independently as she is able to do so with other brands, but that is not the case. The opening is a bit narrow, tight/stiff, and not very flexible, which makes it difficult for her to wear. She refused to wear the shoes as a result.
review.name: Stiff opening
comment: We appreciate your feedback and we're sorry to hear these did not work for you. If we can help please give us a call at 800-288-3124.

name: Bare Steps A83 Sneaker - Toddler Boys'
