review.reviewBody:
My husband never wears sandals however this particular style he likes. They lasted for 6 years & it was time to buy a new pair I CANNOT BELIEVE HOW THE QUALITY IS EVEN BETTER! They’re heavy duty yet beach friendly. The soles are amazing and believe me when I tell you it’s extremely hard to buy for him, however, he LOVES THE NEW PAIR 
Wow ! Thank you for making great quality merchandise it’s very hard to find these days .
review.name: Excellent quality

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Been wearing and abusing my last pair of Newports for at least 15 years…hiking, camping, kayaking, beach, pool, yard work, whitewater rafting, even outdoor martial arts. These sandals are the most functional footwear I’ve ever owned. Beware experienced users: H2’s run 1/2 size smaller.
review.name: Ready for the next decade +

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Nice sandal, but seems different quality from initial builds. It feels more plasticky
review.name: Nice

review.reviewBody: GREAT. . . runs small. . . width fine. . . great color
review.name: GREAT

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I buy a pair of Keen sandals every year for the last 20 years. I wish the sandals would last longer and they would have a lot more different color choices. Other than that they are great sandals. .
review.name: Love My Keen Sandals

review.reviewBody: I have had 10 pair of shoes for several years. I wear them quite often. Great shoes on the pool deck when marshaling or time keeping for the Marlins. I bought the gray and black pair. I might buy the navy blue pair. The shoes are comfortable, however another one half inch of soul would make these the best sandals ever.
review.name: Second Pair!

review.reviewBody:
Seemed to have beefed up construction somewhat, but what used to fit perfectly is now small.
Suggest sizing up 1/2 size or more.
review.name: Beefy

review.reviewBody: . . . AS TONY THE TIGER WOULD SAY. . . UNDERSTANDABLE IF YOU'RE A CERTAIN AGE. . . A VERY COMFORTABLE SNEAKER/SANDAL. . . 🙂✅
review.name: GRRREAT. . . !

review.reviewBody: I love these sandals and wear them everyday during the warm months. I am surprised with how well they hold up. I'm also happy with how comfortable they are. I hiked 7 miles in them one day and never felt like my feet were sore or anything. Couldn't be happier and I'll get another pair once there wear out. I wear wide shoes and these are very comfortable for my feet even though they're not technically wide.
review.name: Best quality sandals I've ever owned

review.reviewBody: Had a pair of these for YEARS! They finally wore out. So, I decided to go with perfection and order another pair. These are GREAT sandles.
review.name: Great

name: Newport H2 Sandal - Men's

hasVariant.description: Buy the Zamberlan Baltoro Lite GTX Backpacking Boot - Men's online or shop all Footwear from Backcountry.com.

review.itemreviewed: Baltoro Lite GTX Backpacking Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody:
Got these boots recently while on a quest to find the “perfect” boots. I have an odd right foot in that I don’t have a normal toe taper… it’s sorta square. To add to this problem my foot is narrow and lowish volume.
WoW! Couldn’t be happier with these for fit, support, weight and grip. Very impressed.
HIGHLY recommend that you use your European size! I wear a 11.5 -12. (45-46) and I ended up with a size 10.5 Baltoro Lite which is a 45!

I live in the Colorado Mountains and hike extensively most days.

Similar products used
Mammut Alp Magic 
Kayland Plume Micro 
La Sportiva. Pamir 
Hanwag. Makra high gtx
Lowa Trekker & Baffin Pro
review.name: Golden Ticket

review.itemreviewed: Baltoro Lite GTX Backpacking Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody:
Updating after a full 16 months or so of heavy use - I think I logged close to 300 miles in these things. 
The folding issue I mentioned below stopped after about a year, but the sides are now folding and I'm starting to get blisters on the balls of my feet, and even just got some on the side after completing Wilson Peak, Mt. Wilson, and El Diente in the San Juans of Colorado, which has never happened before. 
I think they've just worn out - they're much lighter and thinner than my Vioz GTXs, which is a good thing, but at the same time, I think that impacts their durability. 

These boots are still amazing and very comfortable - and they would probably last longer for someone doing more casual hikes. I have used them almost exclusively on very rugged 14ers (I think I've done about 20-25 of them in this pair alone, plus 50 miles in Glacier in July 2021). 

So I think I'm gonna go back to the Vioz GTXs and just buy a new pair. Those are such heavy things but I never once got a blister in them so I trust them more. 


****
I love Zamberlan boots and wanted desperately to give this 5 stars, but I'm experiencing some issues with this pair. 

First, the pros: 
The vibram sole is super grippy and seems to be much more durable than the type found on my previous pair, the Zamberlan Vioz GTX's  
The ankle and arch support is phenomenal. Every time I've come close to rolling an ankle, the boot's structure seems to keep things in check. The bottoms of my feet feel great even after 10+ mile slogs. 
They are much lighter than the Vioz's and the craftsmanship feels superb. You can cruise through scree, sharp rocks, boulder fields, anything a 14er might throw at you, and trust you'll be fine. 

Alas the cons: 
Going uphill, they feel perfect. But going downhill, the boot must fold in such a way that it makes contact with the top of my foot an inch or two below the base knuckle of my big toe - and it hurts quite a bit. 
Zamberlan boots don't typically require a break-in period, and I've worn these on at least 4 hikes, and probably 40-50 miles, and it's still happening. 
I worry it's going to be a permanent thing. 
I wear thick Darn Tough socks (the best out there) for hiking, and still seem to be experiencing discomfort. 

I'm going to keep at it with these boots and hope the downhill issue goes away, but if not, it could mean going for a different pair much sooner than expected, which would be a real shame as these are pricey.
review.name: Updated - 3 overall, still pretty great
comment: Robert M, having put these through the paces, I think I know what Ryan C. was describing regarding the folding of the top of the boot. I experienced the same thing slightly when the boots were new, but as they got a few more miles on them (and getting them wet a few times), it wasn't an issue.

review.itemreviewed: Baltoro Lite GTX Backpacking Boot - Men's
review.reviewBody: Zamberlan has surpassed my wildest hopes and dreams with this boot. I purchased these to guide a 45 day backpacking trip in the Brooks Range of Alaska. I went with the 1110 Baltoro Lite GTX RR to replace my worn out pair of Zamberlan 996 Vioz GTX boots, hoping to to shave significant weight while retaining unparalleled ankle support, aggressive tread, and durability. I was extremely impressed; these boots stood up to the brutally demanding terrain of off-trail travel through the Brooks. The Perwanger leather and generous tough rubber rands withstood beatings from rock and gravel bar walking, thick willow brush, and sharp talus, all while constantly soaked from frequent river crossings. Rain, snow, ice, or shine, the tread provided excellent, dependable traction. The lacing system of these is easy, secure, and reliable with the tough laces and hardware. As a wilderness backpacking guide, I have seen other big brands' boots succumb to the rigors of the tough terrain of the tundra. From my experience with these (lightweight) tanks I cannot recommend them highly enough!
review.name: Burly & dependable with solid support

name: Baltoro Lite GTX Backpacking Boot - Men's

hasVariant.name: Alloy Pocket Trowel
hasVariant.description: Buy the Sea To Summit Alloy Pocket Trowel online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I didn't get a chance to use it yet, but it takes up very little space in my backpack. I wanted a metal scoop that didn't take up space. This fit the bill. Only thing I find as a negative is the cap to the storage in the handle is tricky to open.
review.name: Pooper scooper

review.reviewBody: Not sure yet,need to take it on the trail a few times to Wright a review.
review.name: Not sure yet,need to take

review.reviewBody: Love this trowel, I roll up a mini-roll of backup TP in the handle. I've actually owned this for 10 years. I've been replacing my gear with lighter materials and it occurred to me that this could possibly be mad of titanium, the trowel is heavy (relatively) and it didn't make the cut in my latest weight assessment because it's not "essential" and weighs too much. I'd love to see a titanium version of this.
review.name: Would like a titanium version

review.reviewBody: Way lighter than my old entrenching tool/poop shovel! Love the little storage space in the handle! Great design :)
review.name: Way lighter than my old

review.reviewBody: I never got a chance to use my new Alloy Pocket Trowel. When I attempted to extend the handle, it fell apart. It’s so poorly made that I can’t fix it without it almost immediately falling apart again.
review.name: Don’t Bother

review.reviewBody: Have been using this for several years in the granite and volcanic soils of the Sierra and cascades. Makes quick work of scratching a cat hole. Lighter than a steel folding trowel and tougher than a plastic one. 5 star kit!
review.name: Handy and capable in the High Sierra

review.reviewBody: I bought this thinking the fold away design was an awesome way to reduce the size of my kit. And it is pretty neat. The hollow handle is pretty useless as nothing fits in there. But when it came time to do the number 2, the blade of this thing was useless. It's flat and dull, and wouldn't break the ground, let alone get through the tree roots and such. I do not recommend this trowel at all.
review.name: NEAT IDEA, BUT IMPRATICAL...

review.reviewBody:
I've used the alloy pocket trowel for years. I have a medical condition that requires me to dig a cat hole at least 2 times per day in the back country. This tool makes fast work out of digging cat holes, even in very tough ground. The handle is very comfortable and the stuff bag keeps my other toiletries clean. The hollow handle allows me to store emergency toilet paper. 

The only reason I didn't give it 5 stars is because the locking pin doesn't work very well. It gets stuck and is hard to push. I fixed this by replacing it with a plastic version I got from a pool supply store for swimming pool poles. This may become a problem if it breaks in the future. I'd like to see a better locking system or improved materials from S2S.
review.name: The best!

name: Alloy Pocket Trowel

hasVariant.name: Ramble Rugged Clog - Men's

hasVariant.name: Ramble Rugged Clog - Men's
hasVariant.description: Buy the Chaco Ramble Rugged Clog - Men's online or shop all Footwear from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: They fit very well, are warm, offer good arch support, and have a strong sole with excellent traction. Unlike other open backed slip ones, they remain firmly on my feet and have a small lip around the heel that keeps my feet secure.
review.name: Very comfortable

review.reviewBody: Soooo comfortable!  Bought a pair for my husband’s birthday and got some for myself too.  Although it’s a slip on, the back ‘ridge’ keeps my feet firmly in place.  The footbed is comfortable and I feel like I have finally found a house slipper/shoe for the winter that is possibly going to be used out and about also!
review.name: Great product

review.reviewBody: Extremely comfortable and durable. Highly recommended.
review.name: Highly recommended

review.reviewBody:
I recently purchased these in dusty olive. I needed a solid pair of slip on and the usually suspects of cheap throw aways weren’t cutting it anymore. 

I wear a 11 in z/1’s and 10.5 in shoes. I purchased these in 11 and hoped for the best. They fit perfectly. Quite honestly the 10’s would have been too small. The clog has a great foot bed as its  soft and a little bit curved. Your foot just slides in nicely. The clog itself is really well made and feels like a good product. The tread is fantastic and the clog is warm without being sweaty. I work outside doing walk and wade trips and am on my feet on average 10 hours a day. My feet are tired and sore by the end of the day and I wanted some relief as I recoup at night. Trips continue into the winter as I stay busy all year. I didn’t want to face another season with thin soled crappy slip ons. These really fit the bill. I caught my wife wearing them (although way too big on her) around the house when I came home. They meet her approval as well. 

Alright, enough babbling about myself. These are great slip ons. I will buy again is they ever break rip or tear beyond repair. If you are thinking about this purchase and am not sure take it from this stranger, you will not be disappointed. If you have really wide feet though they may fit a little snug. I’m happy.

Warm
Curved footbed
Solid exterior
Good grip
Adjustable strap for customized fit
review.name: Dusty Olive comfort
comment: Thanks for the awesome feedback Andy!

name: Ramble Rugged Clog - Men's

review.reviewBody: I’ve had a couple cloth belts and they never stay right, this belt maintains its tension and is a much higher quality than I’ve seen before.
review.name: I’ve had a couple cloth

review.reviewBody: If you're looking for a functional, low profile belt that is super durable and doesn't break the bank, this is the one. I wear this on every pair of pants that sag even a little. You can load it up with clip-on weight and probably even use it like a cam strap for tying things down in the wind.
review.name: Durable and Stylish

review.reviewBody: Reviews mentioned tight fit getting strap in buckle. I used a Dremel with a metal grinding bit and opened up the receiving ends of buckle. Bam, no more tight fit, yet snug enough to hold
review.name: Solid with style

review.reviewBody: Love the belt . Took a bit to break it in was so stiff but now it’s perfect to wear
review.name: Love the belt . Took

review.reviewBody:
The belt is fine. It does its job and mostly looks good. There are a couple issues with it, in my opinion, though. 

Firstly, it's super stiff, especially on the edges, and that makes it a bit uncomfortable. I assume it will break-in in time, but it's not great in the near-term.

Second, and more annoyingly, the tolerances on the belt size and the size of the hole on the buckle is so tight that it's actively hard to put on. It's like, weirdly difficult to put the belt through the buckle, and that's just a weird and super annoying issue. I hope that it gets easier as the belt wears in and gets more flexible, but it's really annoying.
review.name: It's fine, basically

review.reviewBody: The buckle was too small and/or belt too wide. Very difficult to insert the belt. Returned.
review.name: Buckle is too tight

review.reviewBody: It looks and feels great! The webbing is a little too wide for the buckle, that makes it hard to operate with gloves on. I love that you can double it back for a full strength climbing sling!
review.name: Excellent belt!

review.reviewBody: Nice belt, performs as expected, holds well.  Color is great
It is difficult to get the belt though the buckle.  The material is very stiff and uncomfortable to wear.
review.name: Difficult to get through buckle

review.reviewBody: I bought this because it was on sale, very nice construction and good color
review.name: nice belt

review.reviewBody: These were my first climbing shoes and I have to say they are a perfect y transition to a higher level shoe. Comfy and not too aggressive. Keep a look out for the toe box, it may just be my foot shape but it did graze the side of my big toe a good amount. Stick to your day to day shoe size, it’s sized down a bit just as the rentals would be.  Still I very much recommend it as a step up to a higher level of climbing
review.name: Surprised

review.reviewBody: This shoe is a very good inexpensive all rounder. I was looking for a cheap beater shoe for the gym so I don't wear out my other shoes on more specific climbs. Fore foot fits my medium to wide feet fine. Heel is really nice and snug and much better than the Scarpa Origins & Reflex (42.5) I've tried where the heel slingshot rand pulls tight on the back of my Achilles/Heel causing pain. Compared to tarantulas/laces (40.5), heel feels a bit more snug and the fore foot is wider on the MadRocks. Other shoes I wear, Evolv Shaman & Zenists (US 10.5), Scarpa Instinct VSR (42.5),  Ocun Ozone HV (US 9.5).
review.name: Great all rounder shoe

name: Rover Climbing Shoe

review.itemreviewed: Arizona Soft Footbed Leather Sandal - Women's
review.reviewBody:
After reading several reviews, I went down a size. I am a 9 wide (40) and my toes seem to be a little on the shorter side. I have 2 pairs of the plastic Gizeh-style Birkenstocks and they do seem a tad large, so I figured I'd try the 39's. Unfortunately, they just barely fit. My short toes went right to the very end. Returning for the larger size.

I've never owned a pair of leather Birkenstocks, but I'm excited to wear what I know will be good for my feet. I suffer terribly from Plantar Fasciitis. The plastic Birkenstocks have been the only thing that gave me relief. Since I can't wear socks with the Gizeh style I have, I need something I can wear around the house during the colder months to keep my Plantar Fasciitis in check. I can't wait to receive the larger size.
review.name: Should have ordered my regular size

review.itemreviewed: Arizona Soft Footbed Leather Sandal - Women's
review.reviewBody:
I love Birks and have about 4 pair.  They are my go to spring and summer shoe.
Never disappoints
review.name: SUPER COMFY

name: Arizona Soft Footbed Leather Sandal - Women's

hasVariant.name: Swell Short - Women's
hasVariant.description: Buy the Free Fly Swell Short - Women's online or shop all Clothing from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Great multi-activity material and design. I like shorts a bit loose, so purchased a medium.
review.name: Versatile

review.reviewBody: I like the length, pockets, and color of these shorts. The material isn't as soft as my other items from FF, but I think it's appropriate for this short. It feels like it will be more durable and shed water easily.The waist is comfortable, but I wish the drawstring could be stretchier and lower profile.The size is a generous medium, but I would still consider it TTS. I think a small would work well for me, but the medium is comfortable and stays up with the drawstring. I purchased these shorts on sale and am pleased with the price I paid. I would not pay full price for this item. I do pay full price for FF leggings and sun hoodies.
review.name: Nice, comfortable casual short

review.reviewBody: This is my third pair!! Super comfy and perfect for a day at the lake, pool, or coast. Quick dry and flexible!
review.name: Favorite shorts ever!!

review.reviewBody: Great fit and length, (some shorts are way too short these days). Soft material and it will be fun to use these for fishing and floating once weather allows.
review.name: Swell Shorts are Swell

review.reviewBody: Love these shorts, classy cut, dries fast. And super comfortable.
review.name: Shorts I love

review.reviewBody: These shorts fit great. Really good length with no thigh bunching.
review.name: Great fit

review.reviewBody: I really like FF products and many pieces. I love the color, the pink are as pictured. My own issue is sizing. I seem to be in between 2 sizes in FF bottoms. I decided to stay with the XL but they are close to huge whereas the L are snug. I have both L and XL in leggings, shorts etc ( it's primarily the bottoms that seem to be hard to estimate how they will fit. ) I don't know what the solution on sizing but that's my reason for 4 Stars. It's just a lot of guess work and the inconvenience of mailing back to return of exchange.
review.name: Nice Shorts

review.reviewBody: Love these for fly fishing, hiking and ranch life. So soft, fit great, dry fast.
review.name: Great shorts for fishing, ranch etc.

review.reviewBody: These shorts are very comfortable and they fit well. The fabric feels great and is of good quality.
review.name: Women's swell short

review.reviewBody: These do not dissappoint! They are cool and comfortable. They are flexible enough to wear anywhere.
review.name: Awesome!

name: Swell Short - Women's

Buy the Gregory 3D Hydro Trek 3L online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: 3D Hydro Trek 3L
hasVariant.description: Buy the Gregory 3D Hydro Trek 3L online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Excellent product. It's the only 3 liter that fits perfectly in my REI Trail 25L pack.
review.name: Lenny is gone hiking

review.reviewBody: Gregory has always (IMO) made well thought & well designed products for backpacking & outdoors excursions. This bladder, with its well thought features proves that Gregory product's are still well worth their expense to have in your arsenal.
review.name: Just like all other Gregory product…

review.reviewBody: This pack fit perfectly in my bag and love the way it’s designed.
review.name: Hydro pack

review.reviewBody: Fits great in or on top of pack, great for campsite use.
review.name: Great product

review.reviewBody: Just the right size and features.  The 3L size is large enough for personal use on a trek.  The size is sufficient for use around camp hanging from a tree for cooking and casual consumption useing the lid spout.  The handle is convenient for filling and caring
review.name: Just to right size

review.reviewBody: I have personally never been a fan of water bladders. I never met anyone who had one that didn't leak, take up a lot of space in their pack when full, or generally just have trouble with them. I really liked how this water bladder acted like reservoir for filling up larger pots for boiling water, I like how the connection from the water bladder to the hose is secure and easy. I also thought that the mouthpiece on the hose was nice. Instead of hanging the water in the pack towards your back I opted to put the water on top of my gear just under the brain of my pack. I definitely lined my pack with a garbage bag before I did this in case there was a leak. But there was none. I liked having the water bladder there for refill and access to the hose. I took a short day hike with my pack and instead hung the water bladder closest to the back of the pack and it worked really well there as well. I really enjoyed this water bladder I thought that it was really great for not only base camp but also for having in your pack. I especially liked how there was a magnet which could hook onto your chest strap in order to hang your mouthpiece so that it didn't get dirty.
review.name: I'm a fan

review.reviewBody: I've been using this for a few years hiking and backpacking. It's a great size and I love how it converts from a hiking bladder to a backpacking bladder and evenly distributed the weight on the top of the pack. The option to use it as a camp water is nice, it had a spiket under the cap. I'd buy this again and actually have two of them.
review.name: Perfect Water Bladder

review.reviewBody: Used this on my first backpacking trip, worked out wonderfully. I hung it from a tree and it was so much easier than constantly pouring from a bottle or from the tube. Worth every penny. Also didn’t leak or anything when in my pack.
review.name: Works great

review.reviewBody: I used this hydration pack on my Kilimanjaro trek, and it held up well being jostled around in my day pack and never leaked. I liked how there were different ways to use it (backpack mode, camp mode, etc) but didn’t really use it for anything other than in my backpack because an actual water bottle felt more practical at camp. I previously had a 2L Osprey hydration pack but wanted to upgrade to a 3L pack instead. My biggest complaint about this product compared to the Osprey is that it was extremely difficult to get it to dry after using it. I’m sure it would be easier with a tool to reach inside or a hair dryer, but I hadn’t bought the cleaning accessory pack and was traveling for a few more weeks after using it. I tried shaking it over and over again, but it took about 4 days to fully dry on its own with the screw top open. Overall, I prefer the Osprey hydration pack because it has a wider opening and allows you to reach a hand in to clean and dry it without having to purchase an additional accessory kit like you would have to for the Gregory pack.
review.name: Durable hydration pack but took forever to dry

review.reviewBody: I really like the shape and ease that it dries when done with the trip
review.name: Really nice shape and convenient to use and hang

name: 3D Hydro Trek 3L

review.reviewBody:
Fox Racing’s Speedframe MIPS Helmet in slate grey isn’t just a helmet; it’s a head-turner. The kind that makes you feel like the trailblazing hero of an action packed blockbuster, where the grey symbolizes the calm before the storm, the thrilling descent, the daring jumps, and the enviable Instagram snaps.

Let's break it down. First off, the color: this isn’t just grey, it’s the kind of grey that whispers sophistication and screams adventure. It’s as if Fox Racing distilled the essence of a storm cloud and forged a helmet out of it. This helmet isn’t just wearing a color; it’s wearing an attitude.

Now, onto the MIPS technology, it’s not magic, but it might as well be. For those who aren't in the know, MIPS stands for Multi-Directional Impact Protection System. It’s like having a personal bodyguard for your brain, subtly hidden beneath that stormy exterior. It’s reassuring to know that while you’re out pushing your limits, your helmet is there to cradle your grey matter like a protective parent.

Comfort and ventilation? Check and check. It feels like Fox Racing hooked up a little AC unit in there. Your head stays cool, even when you’re powering up those killer climbs or bombing down tracks that make your heart race.

The visor is yet another highlight, fully adjustable and just the right size to make you feel like you're in a fighter jet cockpit. It’s not just about blocking the sun, it’s about framing your field of vision so every ride feels epic.
review.name: Grey Matter Matters: Speedframe Helmet

review.reviewBody:
In my current MTB helmet quiver, I have the Fox Dropframe, the Fox Speedframe Pro, and this Fox Speedframe - brand loyalty much?

I've ridden POC, 661, Bontrager, Giro and Fox over the last few years and this helmet has quickly become my favorite.  The Speedframe has an awesome fit with great back-of-head coverage and a nice visor location. It looks great with my big glasses, doesn't hold too much sweat, doesn't bounce around, and the fit dial on the back is easy to adjust with gloves. 

I use this for probably 80% of my MTB rides as well as commuting and my gravel rides. It's not heavy enough to warrant a gravel-specific helmet and it's stylish as an everyday lid. I use the Dropframe for the rowdier stuff where I need to feel more protected (read: confident). 

Notable differences between this and the Pro version are the magnetic stap buckle on the Pro, which I love, but isn't a deal-breaker on this helmet. I use this one more than my Speedframe Pro because for some reason the MIPS on that one squeaks a lot and bugs me as it bounces around a bit when I ride. For whatever reason, this one doesn't so the regular Speedframe it is!

This helmet provides adequate protection for most of my riding, has a great fit, has great vents and doesn't get too hot, fits well with a skull cap under it in the colder months and comes in great colors - what more can you ask for?

Thanks for caring about my brains more than I do (sometimes), Fox!
review.name: affordable AND it looks good!!

review.reviewBody:
This helmet has all the features that a good trail/enduro lid has along with the looks of a top tier helmet. I got the black in a size large and it fit my generally oval shaped head well front to back. It does have some extra room on the sides which means it's still a good fit if your head shape is a little rounder. The retention system wraps around your head like most helmets like this do, but this is the first one I've had that is as well padded at the front. The interior shape of the helmet felt very comfortable.
The one thing I'm constantly looking for in a helmet is the ventilation. I live in Texas and having a lid that stays cool is huge. While you can't see through the helmet like I can with some of my other helmets due to their number of vents. This lid has been surprisingly airy feeling. The only problem is I got the matte black and I'll be interested see how hot it gets in the blazing summer sun.
Other than the black color, my only other complaint is the lack of a light/gopro mount. At this price you shouldn't expect that feature, but I do a fair amount of night riding and appreciate a solid place to mount the lights.
I was really impressed with this helmet. For now it will make a great daytime trail lid. We'll see how it does when the central TX furnace kicks on.
review.name: Pro level helmet, Weekend warrior price!

review.reviewBody:
I would make a list of pros and cons, but very seriously I have no cons. I genuinely enjoy just about everything about this helmet. I was hesitant to give it a go because I have an extremely small head. So much so that in the past I have had to default to kids sizing to find something that would fit, which usually means giving up some of the luxuries of an adult helmet such as breathability and just general quality. This fits right on par with the size chart and the adjustment system accommodates round and oval head sizes. Once locked down it passes a shake test and is pretty comfortable throughout a long ride.

It gives deep enough coverage in the back to make me feel comfortable when things get spicier than intended and is plenty breathable.

I also want to call out that yes there are things that could make this better, but at the price point it is hard to beat and you can always upgrade to the Pro version if you are looking for those added features. It gives deep enough coverage in the back to make me feel comfortable when things get spicier than intended
review.name: For my smaller head friends...this is it

review.reviewBody: Looks like it was someone's return I got. Was missing the spare pads and manuals that came in my other fox helmet that I ordered from a different vendor. However that helmet L was too big I needed a M. Fits ok, color is VERY fluorescent. Good for hunting season I suppose.
review.name: Came missing spare pads and manual

review.reviewBody: The helmet is not even close to the product color "chili"  it is pink. Even my wife thought it was cute!  Returning it for a black one.
review.name: Chili Red is NOT red!

review.reviewBody: I thought atomic punch would more orange. It is definitely more pink than orange.
review.name: Colors not the same as photos
comment: Agree. I am returning as well. They had an orange previously so I thought it would be the same. It's a wierd Pinkish Orangish Flourescent.

review.reviewBody: We ordered two of these and the fit is really uncomfortable. When I first tried it on it seemed to fit just fine, but after 1.5 hours of biking, it digs into my forehead and hurts. Sometimes I have to stop and give my head a break from this awful helmet because my forehead hurts. The MIPS buttons rip my hair out every time I take the helmet off my head, so I often have to sit there and try to untangle the hair so I don't lose big chunks every time I take the helmet on and off. I called Fox and they would not exchange the helmet and told me to try to sell it to some other poor person. I don't ever want to buy Fox equipment again after this helmet.
review.name: I HATE it

review.reviewBody:
Cannot say if this runs true to size, cuz I'm not a helmet size expert (are there even?..) but I ordered a LG and a MD, expecting the LG to fit, and ended up keeping the medium. It's perfect! In every way, for most applications. I use it every day, and on some pretty extreme gnar, to boot.  The trick to sizing is to fully loosen the adjustment boa, then place it on your head and it SHOULD feel slightly loose; then you fasten the boa to your liking. 
This thing actually looks cool, and it's the first helmet I will never ride without. The babes swoon when I roll out with my Speedframe.
review.name: My Fave (along with the Pro version)

name: Speedframe Mips Helmet

review.reviewBody: If you, like me, are excited at owning the latest iteration of what I would consider to be the best seat post on the market, please do not take backcountry’s description literally, as they did not ship the 3.0 and I suspect that they do not actually have them to ship. Bike Yoke is among the most amazing companies in the industry, I wish I could say the same for Backcountry. Returned, as the item description noted that this is for the 3.0, which is definitely not what was received (beyond the box also being opened).
review.name: Bike Yoke is top notch, but mislabeled

review.reviewBody:
I got the Revive to replace the stock RockShock/Reverb that comes with the Santa Cruz. The Reverb would consistently get squishy, even after a single ride.

Generally a thumbs up. 

But a few notes for buyers:
- It's heavier than the Reverb 
- Installation isn't trivial, I had to take it to the shop although there are good YouTube how-tos
- It's cable not hydraulic so if you're replacing a Reverb, you're also going to need a new trigger

I like the feel of the Reverb trigger better than the Revive/BikeYoke. It's not a big deal and I'm sure I'll get used to it, but the way the dropper post engages feels slightly less responsive than the Reverb. With the hydraulic, as you push the trigger there's less resistance as the post releases. In contrast, the Revive trigger doesn't feel like it has a clear release point. I don't feel confident I've pushed hard enough to drop the seat.

I got the impression from my LBS that RockShock may be more amenable to repairing the Reverb. After a few months, my Reverb would get squishy and there wasn't a reliable way to fix it. I'd push the bike shop to repair before speeding the $$ to switch it out.
review.name: So far so good, but some notes...

review.reviewBody: Having terrible time dealing with BikeYoke regarding warranty support. Leaving review and contacting all parties involved.
review.name: 20 hours and multiple marks on stanchion

review.reviewBody: Works perfect - easy to reset when it starts to sag. Happy with this purchase.
review.name: Great

name: Revive 2.0 Dropper Seatpost

hasVariant.name: Rampage Helmet

review.reviewBody: I purchased a helmet in February 2024. It came in the wrong color, missing a tag. I exchanged it for another helmet and the new helmet came used, dirty, and still the wrong color. I sent it back and had to contact this company 5 times to get a refund. It is now April and I just now received a refund minus the shipping costs. I was told I wouldn't be charged shipping, but honestly, it's not worth my time being on hold for another hour and a half. They got me. Don't let them get you too. Go to a store and find a helmet. They will be new with a tag and you know it's the right color and fits well. Lesson learned.
review.name: Avoid buying helmets here

review.reviewBody: Super sick helmet. I bought a M as I already own a M Fox trail helmet that I love. The helmet is super tight! I went ahead and purchased smaller cheek pads and it's not quite as tight, but I wore it for 7 hours straight the first time w/the original pads and I was only starting to be a bit uncomfortable at the very end of the ride. So I imagine the tightness is a good thing in relation to protection. I live in Texas and have only worn it in the winter so far, so we'll have to see how well it breaths when I'm riding in 100+ degree weather, but currently, it's well-ventilated. I feel like it would def do its job if I had a gnarly crash!!
review.name: Rampage Helmet

review.reviewBody: The Coda has long been a high-level, cross-terrain performer. But the all-new Coda – designed with Pat Moore – breaks the evolutionary sound barrier with its forward-facing approach to all-mountain expectations. Its camber profile is supported by Grip Tech contact points to offer a unique combination of power and control. Its wider-platform tip and tail are designed to drive clean turns at high speeds through mixed conditions. And it's Mountain Twin design provides riders with the toolkit needed to get into and out of dicey spots. This is the next-gen Coda – and Pat Moore is putting his name and stamp of approval on it.

review.reviewBody:
Patagonia does it again! This jacket has all the features I need for daily use, and is my new winter jacket (I live in the south so it doesn't get super cold). The fit is perfect and I can wear a thick sweater under it if I really want to, but it's so warm I normally don't need to. It's also breathable which is key for such a warm jacket, and it's water repellent, another key feature as we get more rain than snow where I live. It has three pockets making it easy to store things in the breast pocket leaving the waist pockets free for my hands to stay warm. And the hood provides full coverage without blocking my view or flopping all over the place. 
I highly recommend it to anyone looking for a solid, long lasting mid weight jacket that will provide cozy warmth for years (decades if it's like my other Patagonia products!)
review.name: Perfect!

review.reviewBody: The Nano Air is one of the most comfortable and versatile jackets out there! I wear it all the time because it is so soft, stretchy, and breathable yet warm. It is a great layering jacket in cold temps and is a great standalone jacket in chilly conditions or cold temps when on the move. I have a ton of Patagonia mid layers and jackets, so I’d rate this one in between the Down Sweater and R2 Tech Face in warmth and also is warmer than the Micropuff, Nano Puff, Nano Air Light Hybrid and R1/R1 Air/Crossstrata. The hood is thin enough to wear under a helmet but can also be worn over most helmets. The fit is slightly shorter with a trim regular fit. It isn’t too tight, but isn’t boxy or bulky. Flattering fit for sure. The stretchy hand pockets are also clutch! I love this jacket, live in it, and highly recommend it. I’m Backcountry’s Patagonia Ambassador and expert, so feel free to reach out to me on chat, call 801-204-4562 or email amcclary@backcountry.com if you have any questions on this or other Patagonia products.
review.name: I live in this jacket!

description: Buy the Thule Accessory Strap Kit - 4-Pack online or shop all Ski from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Accessory Strap Kit - 4-Pack
hasVariant.description: Buy the Thule Accessory Strap Kit - 4-Pack online or shop all Ski from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: I found the rack expensive and the straps substandard. Replacement straps should be included in the purchase instead of having to order and pay an unreasonable amount.
review.name: My straps are broken

review.reviewBody:
Reviewing the straps and rack of the old version of their racks.  We had this rack for over ten years and had almost no issues.  One or two straps had single hole failures, but we have tightened them down on trips to the beach and to major bike competitions VERY TIGHT.   I MUCH prefer these stretchy straps to the new ratchet straps which are a pain to use.  I wish they'd go back to this design.  BE CAREFUL WHAT YOU SCREAM FOR.  

On the other hand, when a non-strap related failure struck our old rack, Thule stood by it and replaced the whole thing with a brand new rack.  THAT is a quality company.  Thank you THULE!
review.name: Eulogy to the old stretchy straps I LOVED

review.reviewBody: I recently purchased my first Thule product, and was so excited because I’ve heard about their quality and great customer service. Unfortunately, after using it twice (correctly done so), one of the straps split. I guess I just expected better from this company. After all of these reviews, essentially stating the same thing, you’d think they’d figure out the problem and head back to the drawing boards. There has to be a better solution, especially since it’s a part that is most used. Is it to make it so we need to buy more? This just seems strange considering this is supposed to be a great company- I’d think they’d perfect their products since they are so specialized in what they manufacture. Just my two cents!
review.name: Only used twice, then snapped!
comment:
Hello Rolawna,

I'm sorry to hear that your bike rack straps failed! This is something we can normally easily replace with spare parts. 
While bike rack straps are subject to wear and tear, and so are not generally covered under Thule's limited lifetime warranty, two uses is a bit short of a lifespan, so I'm glad we were able to help out with some replacements under the Thule Guarantee. 
We hope you enjoy lots of rides with your bike rack!

review.reviewBody: Amazing to not need to replace the originals for 10+ years!  Great 4-bike hitch rack for the 3rd SUV IN 10+ years … thanks!
review.name: Replacements … old ones lasted 10+ years!

review.reviewBody: These were very expensive and one has already stopped in half after lesson three months of years. I don’t know what to do to it should stand behind their quality I hope that they will give me everything for them or send me a replacement for the one that broke I am very disappointed.
review.name: One snapped in half after <3 months
comment:
I'm sorry to hear about the damage to one of your straps!
Bike rack straps are generally not covered under Thule's limited lifetime warranty, as they are a wearable part greatly affected by how they are used and the environment they are used in. Individual straps are also available as spare parts, if you do not need a full set of replacements. 
I reached out via email to get some more information on your order and discuss possible solutions.

review.reviewBody: Straps broke after 5 uses. The knob on the bike rack itself that the strap fits over is also breaking. Very disappointed. Back to my SeaSucker Mini Bomber
review.name: Strap Failure
comment:
Thank you for reaching out! I'm sorry to hear about the damage to your straps and bike rack. Broken straps can sometimes be caused by over- or under-tightening them around bike frames. Under-tightening causes bikes to move around more than what is safely allowable and over-tightening can cause undue stress on the material. 

Straps should be snug over the bike, but not stretched to reach another hole.

review.reviewBody:
I bought a Thule bike rack roughly 18 months ago.  I have used it approximately 20 times.  
One of the straps tore.  
It is inconceivable to me that a product that costs that much would break after 20 uses.
review.name: Rip Off.

review.reviewBody: Thule needs to listen to these reviews and change this product.  The straps break and are expensive to replace.  I started keeping the straps in my glove compartment thinking the sun makes them weaker.  Even the new ones break easily.
review.name: Just not good quality and expensive

review.reviewBody: These straps are useless and break from sun exposure and wind. I would not trust it to hold any bike on long high speed destinations.
review.name: Thule rubber straps

review.reviewBody: So glad you had replacement parts for an older model bike rack. Timely delivery.
review.name: replacement parts

name: Accessory Strap Kit - 4-Pack

review.reviewBody: Such nice quality and a ton of thought went into making these. I am rarely impressed enough to write a review
review.name: Incredible Quality

review.reviewBody: These things are amazing, I Ride my MTB through the winter and have tried every glove on the market. My fingers kept going numb until I got these. I am amazed at how warm they are. My hands are actually sweating now in 20 degree weather. But I?m fine with that since they have removable liners that I can wash. The goat leather is very durable and hold up well on the bars, and the finger works great with the brake levers and shifter levers. I would recommend these to everyone who are looking for a WARM DURABLE pair of gloves for biking and snowboarding on the mountains.
review.name: Bought these for MTB in the winter

review.reviewBody: Really well designed ? the trigger finger made it easy to adjust bindings, straps, etc.  These thing are Warm.  I run hot and I could only wear them in -5C and below.  Also make sure you use the balm that comes with them or you?ll end up having to wait for the seams to dry to apply it like I did.  Measured between a 9 and 10 and the 10 fit great.
review.name: Great Warm mittens

name: Army Leather Heli 3-Finger Glove - Men's

review.reviewBody: Super comfy and perfectly fitting gloves. Great looking and very practical. The grip is the best part; it lets me control my bike well. Don't slip, don't stretch too much, not sit loosely on my hands. Definitely recommend it, and I will continue buying this brand.
review.name: best grip

review.reviewBody: My son had to borrow these.  He was kid enough to crash hard....bent the crank on his pedal...severe road rash everywhere.   I thought these might be to thin but not a scratch on his hands!  The gloves did their job and fit well.  I prefer to not collect snot on my gloves but to each their own (other reviewer).
review.name: Nice gloves

review.reviewBody: Maybe I'm the only weird one who wipes the snot/sweat/dirt off their face with the back of their glove, but the rubber triangle texture on these makes it impossible. Decent glove otherwise.
review.name: Not for farmer blowers or face wipers

review.reviewBody: Jacket was exactly what I needed but sadly had to return as the slim fit cut was slimmer than usual, and I have several slim fit jackets and shirts from TNF.
review.name: Extra Slim

review.reviewBody: I used the higher run for my evening run and it is really light and worked on a windy day as well.
review.name: Yes I will buy it again

review.reviewBody: Wo, what a product, I really love it I never expected that it would be so good
review.name: I would suggest to my friends about this product

review.reviewBody: Light enough to pack easily and wear when the temperatures are a bit too chilly for wearing just a t-shirt.  Good wind protection and does a decent job against light rain or mist, though not water proof.  I take it on day hikes in the mountains, and on public transportation, including planes.  Definitely recommend.
review.name: Excellent light protection against wind

review.reviewBody: This high-quality / low-weight Northface "High Run Wind Jacket" was a phenomenal purchase! Its lightweight enough to wear anytime and of course especially works best in rain or while jogging!
review.name: Stellar Northface High Run Wind Jacket - Highly Recommend!

review.reviewBody: It fits well, but the zipper is not smooth and it is difficult to zip it up every time.
review.name: I would not recommend it to a friend

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] It's a nice, light windbreaker. Good quality as always. Fits a bit snug in the mid section but other than that, it's a great jacket. I work at a car dealership, so it's perfect for running inside and out all day long.
review.name: I would buy again.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I would rate this item higher if the zipper system was of better quality. During my run this AM, the zipper opened up from the bottom. Could be indicative of needing a larger size or something else. Otherwise, a great jacket to wear for long, early morning runs. Love the chest pocket. Great placement for storing the phone.
review.name: Running Jacket Zipper Malfunction

name: Higher Run Wind Jacket - Men's

review.reviewBody: Shorts fit smaller than indicated on the web site. Sizing chart said 3XL would fit sizes 44-46" waist, im a 44 and shorts were much too small. I will be returning them.
review.name: Zoic Ether shorts

review.reviewBody: I expected more from Zoic. Loved the look and feel but holes appeared in the cheap fabric after just one ride. No wrecks or anything. Disappointed in the quality. Backcountry was great about exchanging for another brand. Won't buy Zoic again.
review.name: Great looking and comfy, but low quality

review.reviewBody: Haven?t taken them out for a ride yet, but out of the bag, they are a perfect fit for me, and I?m a tough cookie to fit. Short legs. Anyway the real reason for the review is that I ordered the ?fresh? color. Fun fact: Fresh is not yellow. They are actually orange. Not sending back because I really could care less about the color difference and they fit so well. Just wanted to put it out there about the difference in color.
review.name: Perfect fit, color misrepresentation

review.itemreviewed: Speedcross 6 Wide Trail Running Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: I bought my first pair of these boots several years ago and loved them. There are very few truly wide toe boxes on boots out there so I quickly bought them when a friend recommended them. Over the years my foot has grown a bit where I had to size up and was so glad these boots were still in production. Highly recommend for anyone with painful feet.
review.name: Second pair of Speedcross 6

review.itemreviewed: Speedcross 6 Wide Trail Running Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: I’ve had these shoes about a month or so. They’re comfortable. I like the wide toe box. This makes the shoe fit well. The price was good. I bought a spare pair.  This brand fits my feet well and the shoes are helping my Morton’s neuroma in one foot.  I wish the shoes came in other colors besides purple. Black would be nice. And I wish this brand had more wide shoes to choose from.
review.name: Speed cross 6 wide

review.itemreviewed: Speedcross 6 Wide Trail Running Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: I was looking for a WIDE toe box hiking shoe. This one was the only one Salomon recommended. I have worn them on a couple of hikes. I would say they are great in water or mud, however I don't think the top is Gortex because it got weather dirty. Also I like the lacing system, BUT once you tighten the laces its HARD to get the extra lace into the little pocket under the tightened laces.
review.name: Good Wide Hiking Shoe

review.itemreviewed: Speedcross 6 Wide Trail Running Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: Just bought my 4th pair of these. Great tread, fits snug, giving my feet supreme support. I use them for am power walk on sidewalks, so I wear them out faster than if I used them on trails. Also my day shoe for errands. Fabulous in airports and travel.
review.name: My goto shoe

review.itemreviewed: Speedcross 6 Wide Trail Running Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: Punn intended, but yes, I've actually been purchasing Salomon for nearly 20 years and wouldn't wander off from these amazing shoes. Their comfort and performance exceeds expectations.
review.name: 20 year purchaser and running!

review.itemreviewed: Speedcross 6 Wide Trail Running Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: Great fit, great grip on surfaces. No breaking in period, rubbing or blisters. Super thrilled with these so far! I haven’t had them long enough to have an opinion on durability but will update my review at a future date.
review.name: Love these shoes

review.itemreviewed: Speedcross 6 Wide Trail Running Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: I've been wearing this model of the speedcross since they released the wide-width. The durability of the shoe has drastically decreased, and they still haven't made the shoes waterproof like the normal speedcross sizes. Why? I've worn these shoes for trail running, peak bagging, and anything not on pavement. Generally I am pleased with the grip, fit, etc. Most recently I climbed a larger peak but nothing super technical, and my newest speedcross were about 2 weeks out of the box. The entire sole was ripped to shreds by the time I was back to the car. That's never happened before, but I was so disappointed. The talus wasn't anywhere near what I've encountered while wearing prior versions of the shoe...so maybe it's just a lemon? Anyway. My husband has the speedcross as well, and it's annoying that he can do water crossings and not get his feet soaked, while I have almost the same shoe and my feet are soaked. That's probably my biggest complaint -- for the price and model they can't make the wide width waterproof?
review.name: Could Improve

review.itemreviewed: Speedcross 6 Wide Trail Running Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: I have been wearing these shoes for about five months now, walking 20-30km five times a week.  They remain comfortable and durable, with no holes around the toe areas or even any signs of wear.  My only issue is that the treads have worn off in spots and there are a few areas where there may be a hole starting on the bottoms.  From the top they look as good as when I started wearing them though, and that is pretty amazing.
review.name: Durable, comfortable and lightweight

review.itemreviewed: Speedcross 6 Wide Trail Running Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: This is maybe my 3 rd pair of speed cross. Love them so much.  Except the laces.  They are confusing for me but not enough to give them a lower grade
review.name: Love the Wide option and wide toe box

review.itemreviewed: Speedcross 6 Wide Trail Running Shoe - Women's
review.reviewBody: This is the absolute best shoe available today. I walked the Cammino Portuguese without a single blister!!
review.name: Comfort Plus

name: Speedcross 6 Wide Trail Running Shoe - Women's

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Excellent quality - my 7 year old loves it and it keeps him dry
review.name: Just right for my son

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] We were looking for a one and done jacket for our son for fall through spring and this is it. We will dip into the low 30’s overnight and into the morning, but will warm into the 50’s during the day during winter. Late fall and into Spring. So far this has kept him but not over heated. There’s room for layering if we want to venture somewhere colder. It’s a nicer looking jacket than we expected. Shipped quickly too.
review.name: Perfect lightweight jacket for cold mornings.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I have a 4 year old who is pretty picky with clothing and sensory issues, he loves this rain jacket.
review.name: LOVE this jacket, keeps my son dry.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Fits very nicely. Good and comfortable. Great color
review.name: Great jacket

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Lightweight, durable & sized perfectly. Fantastic for hot summer rainy days.
review.name: Best raincoat for summer!

description: Buy the MSR Rendezvous Sun Shield Shelter online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Rendezvous Sun Shield Shelter
hasVariant.description: Buy the MSR Rendezvous Sun Shield Shelter online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Rendezvous Sun Shield Shelter
hasVariant.description: Buy the MSR Rendezvous Sun Shield Shelter online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: This saved our camping getaway several times. It can withstand really high winds and is completely rainproof. Get the extra 2 poles. Amazing
review.name: Incredible

review.reviewBody: I’m very happy with this sun shield. It’s really heavy duty and withstands high winds. It’s nice that you can set it up differently to suit your area you don’t need flat ground like most other tents.
review.name: I’m very happy with this

review.reviewBody: Used it camping solo and it’s light enough to backpack with if you take the poles out. Groundhog stakes don’t work with this is sand and have just used it on the beach with proper stakes for sand and it was brilliant. Kept the gulls off and a welcome respite from the sun. Also good in wooded areas to stop tree sap, twigs, leaves etc falling into food. Built well and very stable.
review.name: Excellent tarp

review.reviewBody:
Directly on delivery I noticed that one guy line was missing and I needed the tarp for m birthday party outside. 
Up to now I was used to the quality of MSR, don't know how that could pass the quality check! 

Not so much amused, because replacement was not immediately possible.
review.name: One guy line missing

review.reviewBody: My Moss Outfitter Wing, is the predecessor to the Rendezvous and has served me well for 25 years. MSR has upgraded the material and you can be confident in this product. I have used it with as many as 6 poles and have flown it off the side of my adventure van using suction cups to attach it to the roof!
review.name: Old School

review.reviewBody:
I’ve only used my new 200 Wing a couple of times this fall and found that it met all my expectations in both wind and rain. It’s a bit of a handful to set up but I’ve used one many times before so we knew what to do. It is ideal for a large party where weight isn’t an issue. 
I expect the stakes that come with it may be a little light in a real blow so I plan to add another bigger/heavier set. In the past we have found double staking some of the windward guy lines usually does the trick.
review.name: Review of Rendezvous 200 Wing

review.reviewBody:
Really good for rain and a wind block as well. 
Cheers
review.name: Really good for rain and

review.reviewBody:
My husband and I love gear and have our fair share for rafting trips. We never had a rain Fly because our friend always brought his on trips. This year he couldn?t make it and we expected rain for our pre season Main trip. Days before we ordered the Rendezvous.  

It was an amazing shelter that pitched quickly and added tons of space for shelter over the kitchen or a sitting place in the shade. We used oar handles to pitch it higher and the convenient pockets at each point made it easy to do so. 

The system needed several of us to hold different poles or to get stakes in the ground. Would be a difficult job with one or two people. Would be great if it came with an extra stake. 

Years ago we bought a tent like sunshade but never took it anywhere because it was so heavy and hot and hard to set up. The Rendezvous packs small and will be with us on every trip.
review.name: Best new gear purchase

review.reviewBody: I use this shelter for rafting, it is a life saver in rainy conditions and exposed sun situations. It is made of high quality material and can be configured into shapes and heights to fit your environmental conditions. It is not easy to set up with one person but if you have a group it goes up quickly. Reading other peoples reviews the common theme seems to be the stakes are inadequate and I would second that. To improvise I made 12 inch wooden sand stakes, once these are pounded into the sand the tarp is not moving even on windy days. Sand stakes were made on a table saw using some old wooden flooring.
review.name: great sun/rain protection but stakes need to be improvised

review.reviewBody: I purchased this item after using a friend's at a park/no wind scenario. I've tried to use it twice on river trips in some medium/breezy conditions. The first time a gust of wind ripped the stakes out and flung them into the forest so I upgraded to 18"" rebar stakes as well as some sand stakes. On my next trip the stakes held but two of the skinny guy lines snapped. I'll be re-rigging the guy lines with stronger cord but what might fail next?
review.name: So far not impressed

name: Rendezvous Sun Shield Shelter

review.reviewBody:
I really like the concept of a light weight set of tights, and have worn these in temps down to 30 degrees F.

My only concern is that the shoulder straps are a bit too short, so I end up with some tightness in my shoulders after a couple hours of riding.

I agree that the chamois is a little light for longer rides: 3+ hours.
review.name: pretty good for what they were designed

review.reviewBody: Chamois is placed wrongly, bunches front especially on climbs. Even on the flat it bunches center. Love Gore Wear products. This set of bibs was a disappointment.
review.name: Bad Design

review.reviewBody: Good compression, cut and fit.  Light and very breathable.  Great shoulder season knickers when you want a little more coverage. My 2nd pair and only thing preventing 5 stars is that I find the chamois is a little light for longer rides (40+ Miles).
review.name: Great 3/4 knicker

name: C3 3/4 Bib Tights+ - Men's

description: Buy the Sea To Summit Breeze Mummy Sleeping Bag Liner online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Breeze Mummy Sleeping Bag Liner
hasVariant.description: Buy the Sea To Summit Breeze Mummy Sleeping Bag Liner online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Breeze Mummy Sleeping Bag Liner
hasVariant.description: Buy the Sea To Summit Breeze Mummy Sleeping Bag Liner online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I used this liner with my StS Trek bag on a double-circuit teahouse trek in Nepal. Teahouse rooms are unheated, and many are over 12,000'. This warm, stretchy and comfortable liner helped keep my bag clean and me warm, the very few times I needed it for warmth.

Only 4 stars, because:
My StS bag has a separate zipper for the footbox, that I usually have open, even at high elevations and thought the liner would, too. I thought this because the pictures online (& even the one StS attached to the email asking for this review), plus wording on the box state the bottom has a drawstring. It doesn't for the semi-rectangular version I needed. So, my dear spouse ripped the bottom open and sewed one in.

StS did apologize for the incorrect wording on the package, and made it as right as they could.
review.name: Great liner. Slight misrepresentation on the package.

review.reviewBody: I've purchased the older version that's the super warm ones for fall camping in Colorado and it was super warm but a little bit challenging for me as I like to poke my feet out of the sleeping bag when I run hot. This design is superb with the option to cinch the feet and the snap buttons on top, really made it much user friendly for someone like me. This material is cooling, perfect for the upcoming summer camping. Super soft material, made it very easy to sleep in. Totally would recommend!
review.name: Love the new updates to the bag liners!

review.reviewBody:
[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] for the hot summer months and for those cold nights that you need something else. 
i mainly use this to cool down my body when it gets too warm but need that extra layer just to stay cool, in the summer this works well with a light blanket. and for the winter i use it to keep my quilt clean but still keep myself cool if it gets too hot, it adds extra layer of warmth because of all the heat being trapped and it is very cozy for sure i love this and planning to buy more.
review.name: Like a Bed Sheet but in the outdoors!

review.reviewBody:
First of all, you NEED a liner for your sleeping bag. If you wash your bedding at home once a week—that being under ideal hygienic conditions where you shower every single day—you really don't want that funk getting into your expensive sleeping bag! That's where a liner really helps!

This liner is an upgrade for me. I've been using a Sea-to-Summit Comfort Blend for several years, and I've really liked that product a lot. But I thought a back-up liner might be nice. But I was really blown away with how nice the Breeze liner is! Mine is the regular Mummy style, and I really appreciate the soft, wicking material that the Breeze is constructed from. Apparently it's a similar material as the Tek towels (I think…maybe its one of the other towels?). I sleep hot, and I sweat a lot at night, so drawing that moisture off is a really nice feature. To help regulate my comfort (including at home) I usually stick my feet out of the end of the bed (and of the liner), so the opening at the bottom is actually a really welcome feature! Yeah…I don't wander the campsite in my liner, but I suppose you could if you wanted to. To each their own!

Anyhow, I really love my new liner. What WAS going to be a spare is now my go-to!
review.name: You NEED a liner as nice as this!

review.reviewBody: I don't normally give five stars, but I really like this product. I have the mummy version and love the drawstring bottom and snaps at the top. The snaps at the top mean you can have your arms free which is great for people who sleep with their hands behind or above their head. It is so easy to wash compared to a sleeping bag. I also have a Reactor liner and the Breeze liner is noticeably cooler to the touch. This is a great product for camping on warm summer nights!
review.name: Amazing product

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This sleeping bag liner is genius. I never knew sleeping bag liners were a thing until we got this product. It's so easy to wash and will keep the sleeping bag clean. I never wanted to wash our sleeping bags because it's such a pain.  I love how lightweight it is. I'm a hot sleeper plus I live in Texas, so this liner will honestly be enough even without the sleeping bag most of the time. I also love the idea of being able to use it in hotels or in travel situations if I'm concerned about cleanliness. It's easy to pack and takes up almost no space. I'm so happy to have this liner.
review.name: Genius Product!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This liner is very soft, I haven’t been able to use it since it’s still too cold in Oregon to go camping but I love the material, definitely going to be great to have the coolmax moisture whicking this summer when it’s hot!
review.name: Great liner for summer camping!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I was happy to test out the Sea to Summit Breeze Sleeping Bag Liner complimentary through Influenster in exchange for my honest review. I had never thought of using a liner before being introduced to this product, but this is actually quite useful. As someone who tends to get hot quite easily, especially while sleeping, this felt great on the skin. As soon as you envelope yourself in this liner, you get a nice cooling effect. The material is soft, lightweight and allows for movement, which adds to a comfortable sleep. This liner is shaped nicely with a hood, arm holes and an open bottom, so you could just wear this out and pull up the bottom if you need to get out of your sleeping bag in the middle of the night, and therefore, not leave this to get tangled in the bottom of the bag or struggle to get comfortably around you. I did notice the cooling sensation wear off while I slept, but I did not wake up drenched in sweat or feel like I was overheating as I often do.  I hand washed this in cold and hung it to dry and it was dry within the day. I believe with proper care this will hold up nicely as long as you do not snag it. Also, this comes with a travel pouch and takes up very little space and would be easy to travel with. I'm very pleased with this product and find it to be a useful solution to hot sleepers like myself.
review.name: Cooling Sensation

name: Breeze Mummy Sleeping Bag Liner

description: Buy the Scarpa Mago Climbing Shoe online or shop all Climb from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Mago Climbing Shoe
hasVariant.description: Buy the Scarpa Mago Climbing Shoe online or shop all Climb from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: I really like the fit of the mago shoe. It feels quite soft and flexible and also structured. Not sure how durable it is yet.
review.name: Great shoe

review.reviewBody:
For a more aggressive shoe, I find these to be on the more comfortable end. Laces and a flexible midsole both help on that front. It may not be my choice for outdoor projecting, but I love using them at the gym. No major complaints at the crag, I just have other shoes that can get the job done better. That isn't to say it's a bad shoe at all. I quite like these shoes even if they aren't the cutting edge of performance for me.

MAKE SURE TO SIZE UP! Fortunately I had read some comments before buying my pair. I usually wear somewhere around a 37.5, but these barely fit at 38.5. Go AT LEAST one full size up from what you'd typically buy unless you want to really squeeze those toes.
review.name: Balance between comfort and performance

review.reviewBody: I usually wear the La Sportiva Solution, size 38.5 – they're tight but not painful. So, I thought Scarpa Mago 39.0 might be fit in my feet. Turns out, it's like two and a half sizes smaller than my Solution! Doesn't make any sense. Scarpa claims 39.0 is like a US Men's 6.5, but that's just not true. Gotta send these shoes back, they're not gonna work out.
review.name: Too small

name: Mago Climbing Shoe

review.reviewBody: The fabric is smooth...like butter! This is a nice lightweight down jacket that I think will work well for Northern CA Fall thru Spring. I like that the baffles are smaller than on most down jackets, giving it a less bulky look.
review.name: Silky soft & comfortable

review.reviewBody: I received my jacket today and unfortunately I thought I was buying a jacket with a hood which is what is pictured on the page I ordered it from. The color is great and the quality seems nice, it just isn't what I ordered. The fit is a little long, and it is a little tight around the chest. I need to send it back.
review.name: Not as pictured

name: Microlight Down Jacket - Women's

review.reviewBody: After another "silly" crash I finally decided I was tired of torn up elbows. I bought the G-Form Pro X-3 because they offered solid protection for most of the XC and trail riding I typically do. They fit well and stay in place on my arms without issue. I would definately buy them again when the time comes.
review.name: Great product for flexible protection

review.reviewBody: I have worn these elbow guards for several years and love them.  They fit well, in fact, perfectly and are very comfortable, plus they last a long time .  They protect my elbows very well from scapes whenever I crash, like just this past week.
review.name: Best, Most Comfortable Elbow Guards

review.reviewBody: This is my wife's second set - she loves them. After a couple of crashes she picked these up and never worries about falling anymore. They stay in place and provide some added thermal protection when it's cold.
review.name: Great protection

review.reviewBody:
I ride in the Arizona desert, very hot, rocky and dry. When I ordered these I was concerned that they would be very uncomfortable but after several rides thes elbow pads stay put and I forget that I have them on. They evaporate moisture throughout the ride and stay cool after several hours of riding in the heat.

The Samrt Flex padding in the elbow and forearm area will give some minor protection to both impact and brushing off on thorny trees and bushes. 

The size that I chose fit as the chart claimed. I have been very satisfied thus far and also have the G-Form Pro Guard Knee pads. I would recommend these to a friend.
review.name: Comfortable elbow protection

name: Pro-X3 Elbow Guard

review.reviewBody: High quality shorts that look nice, but a little hot for Phoenix AZ riding except riding during winter.  Also, they fit well, except the crotch hung a little low, making them a little uncomfortable for longer riding. I do like the looks and the pockets.  They included nice padded underwear that fit really well and were not too padded looking (no diaper).
review.name: High quality -  a little hot

name: Ranger Utility Short - Men's

review.reviewBody: These are great looking pants, high quality material, they fit well everywhere, but are uncomfortably snug at the sight of the convertible zipper.   I've never experienced this before with convertible hiking/fishing pants, and am very disappointed.   Sending them back, at my expense.   I probably won't buy clothing online from this company again.
review.name: Great Quality, but strange upper leg cut
